Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Role Description:

Are you a passionate machine learning engineer with expertise in generative AI? Join our Machine Learning Enablers team at our client in Brussels . You will leverage your expertise in architectures such as retrieval-augmented generation and agent-based systems to develop and enhance reusable AI components, enabling our data scientists to create impactful and scalable solutions.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with data scientists and engineers from our Cloud and DevSecOps teams to implement best practices and ensure technical excellence across multiple projects. Utilizing open-source frameworks like LangChain and Azure-based tools, including the Azure AI Services suite, you will maintain and expand our repository of AI assets. Your innovative mindset will help identify and develop state-of-the-art solutions that deliver business value, while your commitment to staying current with AI advancements will ensure our team remains at the forefront of technology.

As a member of the Machine Learning Enablers team, you will actively research and develop agent-based AI use cases, focusing on multi-agent systems. Your work will support the day-to-day needs of our data scientists through the practical maintenance and enhancement of AI assets, while also driving innovation in our AI initiatives.




Responsibilities:

Develop and Maintain our Generative AI Repository

• Manage and expand our repository of reusable Generative AI components on Azure DevOps, ensuring it’s robust, up-to-date, and user-friendly, and implements MLOps standards.

• Collaborate with data scientists to identify new components to build, provide technical support, and promote best practices in using the repository.

Develop and Implement Agent-Based AI Solutions

• Research and experiment with multi-agent systems and emerging frameworks to address real-world use cases in client's context.

• Develop proof-of-concept projects to validate innovative multi-agent AI applications.

• Design and create reusable components that enable data scientists to integrate agent-based approaches into their projects.

Collaborate and Drive Technical Excellence

• Implement and promote machine learning best practices (e.g., MLFlow), ensuring high-quality standards across the team.

• Collaborate with Cloud and DevSecOps engineers to ensure we deliver high-quality, scalable, and maintainable AI solutions, contributing to setting technical and architectural standards.

• Stay current with the latest trends, models, and frameworks, and communicate them to the team.




Education

•Master’s degree in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.

• A Ph.D. is a plus, especially with research in Generative AI or agent-based systems.







Professional Experience

• Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience in a business environment.

• Proven experience working with generative AI models and LLMs in real-world projects.

• Demonstrated ability to develop proof-of-concept projects, and transition innovative solutions to production-ready components.

• Strong collaboration and communication skills, with experience working alongside a diverse team of technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Technical Skills

• Strong coding skills in Python, with proficiency in software development best practices, including version control (e.g., Git) and DevOps (e.g., CI/CD pipelines).

• Hands-on experience implementing MLOps best practices (e.g., experiment tracking with MLFlow).

• Experience with Microsoft Azure and Azure AI Services.

• Experience with LangChain and other Generative AI frameworks.

• Ability to drive innovation by experimenting with new techniques and frameworks to solve real-world problems.

• Familiarity with Retrieval-Augmented Generation architectures and improvement techniques.

• Strong communication skills for providing technical support, mentorship, and clear guidance to team members.

• Strong collaboration skills and ability to manage tasks independently.

• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail.




Nice to Have

• Experience contributing to the development of reusable AI components or libraries, contributions to open-source AI projects.

• Experience with multi-agent systems and related frameworks (e.g. LangGraph, CrewAI, AutoGen).

• Familiarity with monitoring and evaluation tools for generative AI applications.




Languages

Fluent in English and preferably also French and/or Dutch.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
I am currently searching for a senior freelance Data Scientist to join a valued client of mine in Brussels.




In your day to day, you will apply advanced graph theory, learning, and mining techniques to extract insights, optimize application lifecycle management, and support cloud migration efforts. This role offers the chance to work on cutting-edge technologies and contribute to impactful digital transformation projects.




Key Responsibilities:




Modernize Application Lifecycle Management: Develop strategies for optimizing application lifecycle management and migration processes, leveraging advanced graph learning techniques.




Advanced Methodologies: Apply cutting-edge graph theory, graph mining, and machine learning methods to exploit the knowledge graph, contributing to both operational efficiency and strategic decision-making.




Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, developers, and business stakeholders, to ensure successful integration of data science methodologies into the organization's digital transformation efforts.




Innovation: Identify opportunities for improvement, propose new solutions, and stay ahead of industry trends in digital twins, AI, and graph learning.







Required Technical Experience:




AI & Machine Learning: Expertise in R, Python, and graph learning technologies.




Graph-Based Approaches: Experience with knowledge graphs, graph mining, and related technologies.




Programming & Tools: Proficiency in Python, Spark, SQL, and familiarity with tools like GitLab, Jupyter, Kubernetes, Docker, Jenkins, and Nexus.




Databases: Strong working knowledge of Neo4j and SQL databases.




Analytical Skills: Exceptional ability to synthesize complex data, think critically, and propose data-driven solutions.




Education: A Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field is required. A PhD is a plus.




Languages: English and Dutch OR French




The Offer:

Long-term freelance contract
Hybrid working in Brussels
Up to €650 per day (DOE)
Start date ASAP




If you are interested in this position, please apply now!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer – Intelligent Document Processing (IDP) Platform

Location: Remote/Brussels




This comapny is an early Start-up with limited Ressources, be clear about your expactations ! This is not the Usual job, salary expectations are low to none.




Company: PropEase (IDP platform for real estate document management)

PropEase is building an advanced IDP platform to revolutionize real estate data room management. We’re looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to further develop three core features as a proof of concept. No fluff—just challenging technical work that will drive automation in real estate.




Your Mission:




Auto Classification of Documents

Develop unsupervised learning models, leveraging clustering methods to automatically classify documents commonly found in real estate data rooms.

Smart Search with NLP

Build a context-aware search engine using NLP, enabling users to retrieve the exact documents based on semantic understanding rather than keyword matching.

Document Alert System

Create an alert tool that detects missing or expired documents by comparing current data room contents with a standard full data room, helping users maintain compliance.




What We’re Looking For:

Can develop a first local Proof of Concept with Make, Gradio or StreamLit
Strong experience in clustering algorithms (K-Means, DBSCAN, etc.)
Deep understanding of NLP models (BERT, GPT, etc.)
Familiarity with document management in real estate is a plus
Proficiency in Python and relevant libraries (scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow)
Hands-on experience deploying ML models in production environments




Why PropEase?

You’ll be shaping the foundation of a cutting-edge platform aimed at transforming how real estate professionals manage their data rooms. If you're a technical expert eager to lead these features and push boundaries, we want to meet you.

Show more

Title: Freelance Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Description: We are seeking a skilled Machine Learning Engineer for a contract position in Brussels.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, build, and implement machine learning models and pipelines
Collaborate with data scientists and software engineers to translate business needs into ML solutions
Optimize and fine-tune machine learning algorithms for performance and scalability
Work with cloud-based platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP) for ML deployment
Analyze large datasets to identify patterns and insights that drive business value
Maintain and improve existing models, ensuring accuracy and efficiency




Requirements:

Proven experience in machine learning, data science, or AI engineering
Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, and relevant ML libraries
Strong knowledge of data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation techniques
Familiarity with cloud platforms and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
Fluent in English; French or Dutch is a plus

Duration: 6-12 months (with the possibility of extension)

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
As an Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right ML solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.

Responsibilities

  • Develop AI applications using state-of-the-art (Gen)AI technology;
  • Translate business requests into AI applications;
  • Identify high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization;
  • Pilot prototypes in production processes to demonstrate their value;
  • Deploy prototypes to production, with support of IT, to obtain reliable, scalable systems;
  • Present your results in a clear manner and discuss them with multi-functional project teams;
  • Work in close collaboration with business experts (e.g. for requirement gathering, data source identification, data and process understanding, feature engineering, result validation, etc.), with IT (e.g. for ETL, deployment to production, etc.) and with other AI engineers in the team (e.g. for knowledge sharing).


Profile

  • PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.)
  • 3+ years of relevant work experience in a business environment


Technical Skills

  • Hands-on experience with Python and its AI ecosystem;
  • Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art AI and statistical methods;
  • Experience with cloud technology (Azure);
  • Experience using LLM’s and commonly used libraries to interact with LLM’s (Langchain, Llamaindex, ...);
  • Proven proficiency in the end-to-end AI project life cycle, including:
  • Translating business requests into data requirements.
  • Identifying high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.
  • Developing AI solutions (incl. feature engineering, model fitting, etc.).
  • Deploying scalable AI applications to production.
  • Any experience with following elements is a big plus:
  • MLOps practices, e.g. orchestration with Airflow, Gitlab CI/CD, etc.
  • Containerized deployment of ML products – e.g. docker, podman, Kubernetes


Attitudes/Behavior

  • Passionate about AI and a constant learner;
  • Result-oriented and highly proficient in transforming data into actionable insights that create business value;
  • Team player with strong communication and presentation skills;
  • Able to manage AI projects in an autonomous way and drive collaboration with domain experts, data engineers and other AI engineers;
  • Knowledge in the field of telecommunications is a plus.


Languages

  • Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) + Fluent in English.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Context

The Center of Expertise Data Management is coordinating the efforts of all entities of Degroof Petercam related to Data Governance, Data Quality, Data Storage and Data usages (AI use cases & reporting)

Your Position

As a Data Scientist at the CDO Office Degroof Petercam, you will support the team by delivering AI and smart automation use cases. Your main objective in this function will be to automate all sorts of data tasks within the bank. You will engage with business to look at how you can deliver them value, understand their use case, and solve it in a highly interactive process. Some cases will require advanced modelling techniques, or LLM’s; others are two regexes and an intelligent merge.

Other Tasks Include


Updating development documentation;
Creating and updating dashboards (PowerBI);
Creating and updating self service pages (Train your users);
Process automation by scripting;
Deployment, decommissioning, and monitoring of running applications;


Your Profile

You are holding a Master’s degree in an orientation with statistical knowledge, and have a good knowledge of programming. The latter being more important than the former.


You have excellent writing skills and are fluent in English, and French or Dutch.
Your personal motto is “Show me the code”.
You’ve mastered Python
You’ve heard of Apache Airflow, LlamaIndex, MS Azure, PowerBI, and Containerization and would like to know more.
Team spirit is in your DNA, and you like to work in a dynamic team in a challenging environment.


Our offer

Degroof Petercam is big enough and small enough to matter since we are independent, operate internationally and have different métiers under one roof.

Entrepreneurship is our DNA, expertise is our fuel. You will become part of a company with highly skilled, talented and passionate experts that aim for nothing less than excellence.

The Impact Of Our Work Goes Beyond Profit By Looking At Business From a Broader Perspective, Challenging Those Who Want To Intellectually. In Addition To Our Fascinating Work Environment, We Also Offer


A broad offer of learning & development programs including a Degroof Petercam Academy for both professional and personal goals.
An attractive and market conform compensation package
Flexible working hours & teleworking
An Employee Social Engagement Program
Access to the same Private Banking Expertise as our clients


Show more

Title: Data Scientist - LLM
Description:
Python Data Scientist/Analyst

Experience: 4 - 20 Years

Location: - Anywhere in the World - Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6-12 months

Work Hours: 5 hours overlap with PST time zone

Standard work hours are 8 AM PST - 4 PM PST.

Must-Have


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming.
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills.


Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Data Scientists & Analysts proficient in Python to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with companies in the US looking to develop cutting-edge commercial and research AI solutions.

Job Responsibilities


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues, but also use your business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Communicate clearly with researchers and help the organization in realizing its objectives
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks, or other suitable mediums
Fix bugs in the code and create thorough documentation
Utilize extensive data analysis skills to develop and respond to important business queries using available datasets (such as those from Kaggle, the UN, the US government, etc.)
Effectively communicate with the researchers to comprehend the needs and provide the results


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming
Strong data analytic abilities and business sense are required to draw the appropriate conclusions from the dataset, respond to those conclusions, and clearly convey the key findings
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Excellent communication abilities to work with stakeholders and researchers successfully
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills

Title: Data Science Strategist
Description:
We are currently seeking a motivated Data Science strategist to help our customers further develop their AI capabilities. The ideal candidate has a strong academic background in data science, engineering, or related fields, and possesses extensive experience in leading innovation projects. We are looking for someone who enjoys building a new business together and thinks along with the needs of our customers.




Responsibilities:

Develop and implement strategic initiatives to meet the organization’s AI and data needs, including utilizing Microsoft Fabric.
Collaborate with diverse stakeholders to drive quality improvement and innovation within the organization.




Requirements:

Extensive knowledge and experience with both data science and AI technologies, including programming languages such as Python or R.
Familiarity with Microsoft Fabric, Azure DevOps, and Data Build Tool (DBT) for data management and analytics
Strong experience in building, optimizing, and deploying LLMs.
Experience with coordinating technical teams and utilizing project management tools.
Excellent analytical, strategic, and problem-solving skills.




Strengths:

Accountability for team development and growth.
Ability to think strategically about decision-making and implementation of innovations based on data analysis and Microsoft technologies.
Strong technical background and a commitment to continuous improvement in a modern technological environment.




If you are a passionate professional looking to advance in a dynamic environment and have a proven track record in guiding and innovating at a strategic level in data science, we invite you to apply.

Title: YPP, Data Science & Innovation
HTML:
The Young Professionals Programme


Through times of crisis and peace, NATO has safeguarded our freedom and security for 75 years and counting. Threats evolve every day and NATO is continuing to adapt to keep us safe. Together we will make sure our Alliance remains ready today to face the challenges of tomorrow.


We are launching an accelerator for your international career – the second cycle of our Young Professionals Programme (YPP). Through this global three-year programme, you will experience the frontline of a political and military alliance and start a journey of personal and professional development in a diverse and inclusive work environment. Together, we will enable NATO to:

  • Address existing and emerging global challenges with security implications;
  • Facilitate political consultation and dialogue between nations;
  • Leverage innovation, science and technology to support peace and security;
  • Stay ahead in cutting-edge domains such as cyber defence and aerospace;
  • Support multiple operations on land, at sea and in the air around the world;
  • Contribute to the global effort to combat terrorism, piracy and human trafficking; and,
  • Run crisis-management exercises that mobilize thousands of people and items of equipment.


Do you want to make a difference and help protect close to one billion people across 32 NATO member states, including your own? If you are ready to take on this challenge, and are a national of a NATO member state, hold a Master’s degree and have at least one year of work experience, then apply for the YPP.


With you, we are stronger.

#WeAreNATO


Your role


During the three years of the programme, you will be assigned to three different NATO bodies:


Year 1 - NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCIA) - (The Hague, The Netherlands)

Year 2 - Allied Command Transformation (ACT) - (Norfolk, United States of America)

Year 3 - NATO International Military Staff (IMS) – NATO HQ – NATO Standardization Office (NSO) - (Brussels, Belgium)


For more information, please see the path narrative here. You can also find more information about the NATO bodies here & the NATO Young Professionals Programme here.


This is an opportunity for you to apply your knowledge and skills in the broader area of Data Science & Innovation. As you gain experience, you will be given increasing responsibilities, such as:

  • Developing, implementing and promoting the use of data science and Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies in support of NATO policy development and NATO’s digital transformation;
  • Working on data science projects that contribute to better decision-making and multi-domain military operations;
  • Researching and employing research and analysis techniques (e.g. modelling, simulation, war gaming, Analyses of Alternatives);
  • Supporting the development of joint analysis of operations, training, exercises and experiments, based on technical requirements defined within the NATO enterprise;
  • Constantly scouting for new ideas, adoption of innovation and technological developments of relevance to the Alliance;
  • Coordinating and collaborating with stakeholders across NATO, Allies, partners and Industry in support of achieving allied objectives;
  • Informing the Strategic Level about military implications of Technological Innovation; and,
  • Researching new trends within the areas of responsibilities of Data Science & Innovation.


Who we are looking for


The changing pace of the world demands that NATO and its people remain flexible, eager to learn and able to work effectively with a variety of stakeholders from diverse backgrounds. For a YPP position, we are looking for candidates with at least 1 year of professional experience.


For the YPP Data Science & Innovation path, we are generally interested in the following educational backgrounds:

  • A Masters’ degree in the field of STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics);
  • Any other degree that you believe can be useful to the area of Data Science & Innovation – let us know how your knowledge and skills can be applied!


Any of the following experience or skills would be considered as an asset:

  • Academic knowledge or professional experience in the fields of Data Science, Artificial Intelligence (AI), and Operational Research & Analysis;
  • Understanding of AI and data science, including but not limited to technology and policy matters, particularly as applicable to security and defence;
  • Experience with writing policy reports on technology topics, preferably in the areas of AI and data;
  • Genuine interest in Technology Innovation topics in international and multi-disciplinary contexts;
  • Experience with at least one data analysis tool (such as Power BI, Matlab, KNIME, Python, VBA) preferably in the context of a project;
  • Experience with Natural Language Processing, machine learning engineering, or computer vision;
  • Knowledge of NATO, its agenda, policies, military posture, and/or partnerships;
  • Prior professional experience or internship with other International Organizations, National Administration, research or tech industry;
  • Any additional training/certification(s) related to Data Science & Innovation and project or program management certification;
  • A curious & innovative mindset;
  • Strong analytical & drafting skills;
  • Proactivity, can-do attitude and a willingness to learn and share information; and,
  • Teamwork, excellent communication, facilitation and interpersonal skills.


What we offer


NATO will offer the Young Professionals:

  • An experience of a lifetime at the forefront of an international organization where you’ll have the opportunity to develop your skills and expand your professional network;
  • A diverse and stimulating work and personal experience where you will be assigned to three different NATO bodies around the globe, one each year; and,
  • A competitive salary and other benefits, including excellent health insurance and a generous annual leave package of 30 days.


Are you interested in being part of NATO and the YPP? Apply by 27 October 2024 [23:59 – CET Brussels]


RECRUITMENT PROCESS


Please note that we can only accept applications from nationals of NATO member countries. Applications must be submitted using e-recruitment system, as applicable:

  • For NATO civilian staff members only: please apply via the internal recruitment portal (link);
  • For all other applications: www.nato.int/recruitment


Please note that at the time of the interviews, candidates will be asked to provide evidence of their education and professional experience as relevant for this vacancy.

Appointment will be subject to receipt of a security clearance (provided by the national Authorities of the selected candidate) and approval of the candidate’s medical file by the NATO Medical Adviser.


More information about the recruitment process and conditions of employment, can be found at our website (http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/recruit-hq-e.htm)

Title: AI Data Scientist
Description:
AI Data Scientist AI/ML (Previous pharmaceuticals experience)

Fully remote - Europe based

1 Year contract




We are seeking an experienced AI Data Scientist with a strong background in deep learning and a passion for hands-on coding and modelling. In this role, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and deploy models that solve complex business challenges.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and deploy deep learning models to tackle business problems.
Perform hands-on coding in Python, R, or similar programming languages to build scalable AI solutions.
Research and implement the latest advancements in AI and deep learning techniques.
Collaborate with data engineers and product teams to integrate models into production systems.
Continuously optimise and refine models for performance, scalability, and accuracy.
Communicate results and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.




Requirements:

4-5 years of experience in data science, with a focus on deep learning and AI.
Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or other deep learning frameworks.
Strong understanding of neural networks, CNNs, RNNs, and other deep learning architectures.
Experience with large datasets and deep learning model training at scale.
Incredibly hands-on in coding, data wrangling, and model development.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering practical AI solutions.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) for AI model deployment is a plus.
Must have a PHD

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
🚀 We're Hiring: AI Engineer🚀




Location: Fully Remote (EU) | Occasional Travel (Once Every 2 Months)




Are you passionate about artificial intelligence and looking for a fully remote opportunity within Europe? Our client, a cutting-edge tech company, is seeking an experienced AI Engineer to join their growing team!




What You’ll Do:




Design, develop, and deploy advanced AI models and solutions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI into various applications.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning.
Occasionally travel across Europe (once every two months) to meet the team and stakeholders.




Requirements:




✅ Proven experience in AI engineering, machine learning, and deep learning.

✅ Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow, and other AI tools.

✅ Strong problem-solving skills and ability to handle complex data.

✅ Must be based in the EU, with the ability to travel occasionally.




Why You’ll Love This Role:




🌟 Fully remote role with flexible working hours.

🌟 Join a dynamic team at the forefront of AI technology.

🌟 Competitive salary and great perks.

🌟 Opportunity to work on innovative projects and make a real impact

🌟 Up to 90,000 EUR Salary + Many additional Perks




Ready to take the next step in your AI career? Apply now.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
RED Global is currently recruiting for a Machine Learning Engineer - AI for our client, a global organisation who undertaking a large complex digital transformation program. They are looking to bring on board an experienced ML Engineer – AI with extensive experience of Machine Learning, Generative AI, Solution architecture and Data Science platforms.

Key responsibilities:

Responsible to define and implement best practices for building, testing, and deploying scalable AI solutions with a strong focus on generative models and LLM.
Design and implement solutions with the use of ML and Generative AI tools and technologies, with a strong focus on end-to-end automation.
Accountable to build and design cloud hosted generative AI solutions.
Work closely with customers to identify issues and support them in implementation of their ML ecosystem.
Develop Solutions to ensure robust and secure data pipelines and infrastructure to support AI model training and deployment.
Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in Generative AI and Machine Learning.
Lead the evaluation of new AI tools, frameworks, and methodologies.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Dutch or French with good senior level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.




Required skills:

4+ years’ experience in designing and building AI solutions.
Hands on expertise in ML techniques, deep learning frameworks, image processing and AI-related technologies including Generative AI.
Previous worked across various cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure.
Must have experience of using data science platforms such as Databricks, AzureML, SageMaker and frameworks such as TensorFlow or similar.
Good knowledge of DevOps, MLOps, DataOps and LLMOps principles.
Native Dutch or French speaker and professional working proficiency in English.

Title: Data Scientist - ML
Description:
RED Global is currently recruiting for a Data Scientist for our client, a global organisation who are scaling up their data capability. They are looking to bring on board an experienced Data Scientist with experience of Machine Learning, GenAI and solution architecture and software engineering.

Key Responsibilities:

Responsible to support and advice various clients to identify and define problems and resolve these complex issues for the business.
You will interact with graph databases through standardized APIs and query languages and work with ETL Prosses.
Use AI techniques such as GenAI, supervised and un-supervised machine learning techniques.
Work across the latest data science platforms (Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks (e.g., Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn).
Support with building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) including Cloud provisioning tools (e.g., Terraform).
Advising to the business stakeholders on data driven marketing - working closely with third parties and, internally, with digital teams, IT, and others.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and French/Dutch with good senior-level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.




Required skills:

3-5 years experiences as a Data Scientist working within global organisations.
Extensive work experience of various Data Science Platforms such as Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn.
Experience building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Must have technical knowledge of Machine Learning (ML) or GenAI.
Industry skills: Manufacturing or Life sciences would be a plus.
Strong analytical skills and appreciation of coding languages, data sources, data matching and data acquisition.

Title: Data Scientist (H/F)
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment.




For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 40 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions – we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and production.




You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Science solutions
Going into production with Data Engineers
Creation of POC, model development
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?

You have a Master in engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics…) and you have some experiences as a Data Scientist !
You have bases in the realization of POC, the development of models and applications starting from- scratch as well as in the putting into production
You master programming best practices such as code versionning (git), IDE use (PyCharm fore.g.), testing, use of CI/CD tools
You are fully proficient in Python, Machine learning & Deep learning frameworks (Scikit-Learn & Tensorflow for e.g.) and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
You are familiar with some of the following domains: time series, NLP, Computer Vision, reinforcement learning, IoT
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Als ervaren data scientist puur je relevante inzichten uit de grote hoeveelheid data waarover Colruyt Group beschikt. Je maakt statistische modellen en geeft strategisch advies aan onze verschillende retailmerken. Het resultaat van jouw werk: een nog betere dienstverlening op maat van onze klanten.




Wat doe je concreet?




In de divisie Data & Analytics werk je in multidisciplinair team bestaand uit data science engineers, bi engineers, business analysts, … Samen bieden jullie analytische oplossingen aan voor de verschillende Colruyt Group merken, zoals Colruyt, Okay, Bike-Republic of Jims. In het data science kennisgroep worden ervaringen en kennis uitgewisseld. Op deze manier blijf je bijleren.
Als data scientist werk je samen met complementaire collega’s aan een brede waaier van projecten waarbij je in aanraking komt met nieuwe technieken en technologieën. We moedigen je ook aan om zelf, in overleg met het team, op zoek te gaan naar nieuwe methoden en technieken en zo de kennis en skills van de groep te vergroten. Naast een heel ruim aanbod aan interne opleidingen krijg je ook de kans om aanvullende opleidingstrajecten te volgen. Op die manier bouw je continu aan je business-kennis, je technische skills en je sociale vaardigheden.
Met het team focussen we enerzijds op onze interne klanten, de business-partners. We vertalen hun vragen in analytische projecten die we aanpakken in multidisciplinaire teams. Dat resulteert in een directe en nauwe samenwerking met ETL, software development en de businesspartner.
Anderzijds zijn we ook verantwoordelijk voor de identificatie van nieuwe analytics-opportuniteiten. We gaan proactief op zoek naar nieuwe inzichten die een toegevoegde waarde creëren voor onze partners. Daarbij kijken we uiteraard niet alleen naar Colruyt Group, maar volgen we ook de externe trends op het vlak van use cases rond analytics en technologische innovatie.
Colruyt Group bestaat uit veel verschillende entiteiten. Dat zorgt voor een enorme variatie en hoeveelheid aan data én use cases. De projecten waar je aan meewerkt gaan dan ook van klantensegmentatie over verkoopsprognose en analyse van winkeltesten tot operationele efficiëntie van machines, predictive maintenance en optimaal gebruik van grondstoffen.




Je werkt in Halle en kan tot drie dagen per week thuiswerken.




Profiel




Opleiding en ervaring – Je hebt een solide basis in handels- en of computerwetenschappen, statistiek, wiskunde of ingenieursstudies. Je hebt minstens 3 tot 5 jaar relevante ervaring.
ennis statistische modellering – Je hebt een uitstekende kennis van statistische modellering en kan deze implementeren in Python. Je hebt kennis van SQL en datavisualisatie-technieken.
Analytisch vermogen – Je slaagt erin om data te vertalen naar inzichten en je kan die ook helder en duidelijk communiceren.
Talenkennis – Kennis van het Nederlands is een must. Je praat zeer vlot Engels. Kennis van het Frans is een plus.




Wij bieden




Stimulerende werkomgeving – Je belandt in een ongelooflijk boeiende en rijke data-omgeving, krijgt ruimte voor initiatief en krijgt een brede kijk op het bedrijf.
Permanente leermogelijkheden – Je leert dagelijks bij en krijgt ook de kans om jouw talenten te ontwikkelen via interne en externe opleidingen. Op termijn zijn er ook reële doorgroeikansen.
Aantrekkelijk loonpakket – Je krijgt een competitief loon met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, winstdeelname en maaltijdcheques.

Show more

Title: Expert in AI/NLP/ML - Hybrid - Brussels, Belgium
Description:
Expert in AI/NLP/ML

Hybrid, Brussels, Belgium

300-345 euro/day







1. CONTEXT/INTRODUCTION




European Commission agency which covers areas of substantial societal and political significance, and ensures the strategic implementation of EU flagship programmes including Erasmus+, the European Solidarity Corps, Creative Europe, the Marie Skłodowska-Curie Actions and the European Institute of Technology (EIT).




2.DESCRIPTION OF THE TASKS




Key tasks:

• Design and Development:

o Architect, design, and implement advanced machine learning models, including but not

limited to deep learning, reinforcement learning, and large language models (LLMs).

o Develop scalable AI solutions using state-of-the-art techniques and frameworks.

o Collaborate with data scientists to refine data preprocessing, feature engineering, and

model training pipelines.

• Deployment and Integration:

o Deploy machine learning models and AI solutions into production environments, ensuring

scalability, performance, and reliability.

o Integrate AI models with existing systems and workflows, providing seamless functionality

across platforms.

o Optimize models for performance, including latency, throughput, and accuracy,

considering both cloud and edge deployment scenarios.

• Research and Innovation:

o Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI, ML, and LLM technologies, and apply

them to enhance our AI capabilities.

o Experiment with new algorithms, architectures, and techniques to push the boundaries of

AI within the organization.

o Contribute to research publications, patents, and open-source projects as appropriate.

• Collaboration and Communication:

o Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and

translate them into technical solutions.

o Communicate complex AI concepts and technical details to non-technical stakeholders

effectively.

o Mentor junior engineers and provide guidance on best practices in AI and ML

development.

• Testing and Evaluation:

o Conduct rigorous testing and validation of AI models, including A/B testing, cross-

validation, and error analysis.

o Monitor model performance in production and iterate on models to improve accuracy and

robustness.

o Implement monitoring systems to detect model drift and ensure continued performance over time.




3.LEVEL OF EDUCATION




• Master/Bachelor’s Degree




4.KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS




Following skills and knowledge are required for the performance of the above listed tasks:




• Experience:

o Proven experience in designing, implementing, and deploying advanced machine learning

models and AI systems.

o Strong experience with large language models (LLMs) and natural language processing

(NLP) techniques.

o Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure).

• Technical Skills:

o Deep understanding of machine learning frameworks and libraries.

o Experience with data processing and ETL tools.

o Familiarity with MLOps practices and tools.

• Soft Skills:

o Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and creatively.

o Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.

o Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and independently with minimal

supervision.




Non-technical skills:

Capability of integration in an international/multicultural environment, rapid self- starting capability and experience in working in team;
Ability to work in multi-cultural environment, on multiple large projects;
Excellent Team Player
Ability to understand, speak and write English (B2)
High degree of discretion and integrity is required

Title: Data Scientist - Fully remote - 1 year contract
Description:
Are you passionate about cutting-edge AI applications in healthcare and biotech? Join our innovative team, where your expertise in AI models and leadership skills will drive transformative solutions. We're looking for a seasoned AI expert with:




What You’ll Bring: • Mastery of AI models like Transformers, RNNs, and CNNs across NLP and sequence data. • Deep experience with Large Language Models (LLMs), including prompt engineering, LangChain, embeddings, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG). • Pioneering AI solutions in biology & chemistry using NLP-inspired models. • Expertise in knowledge graphs & Graph Neural Networks (GNNs). • Expert-level Python programming & cloud computing optimization for high-performance AI. • A collaborative mindset to elevate team performance. • Strong grasp of AI explainability, ethics, and bias. • Advanced statistical methods for analyzing AI results. • A master’s or Ph.D. in Computer Science or related computational field. • 3+ years of leadership and publication success in deep learning and applied AI research. • Proven experience in end-to-end AI model development for large-scale, real-world datasets.




Bonus: Tech industry experience or background in pharma, biotech, or healthcare!




To hear more about this position please contact me at rdochi@redglobal.com

Title: Sr Data Scientist - LLM
Description:
Python Data Scientist/Analyst

Experience: 4 - 20 Years

Location: - Anywhere in the World - Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6-12 months

Work Hours: 5 hours overlap with PST time zone

Standard work hours are 8 AM PST - 4 PM PST.

Must-Have


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming.
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills.


Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Data Scientists & Analysts proficient in Python to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with companies in the US looking to develop cutting-edge commercial and research AI solutions.

Job Responsibilities


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues, but also use your business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Communicate clearly with researchers and help the organization in realizing its objectives
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks, or other suitable mediums
Fix bugs in the code and create thorough documentation
Utilize extensive data analysis skills to develop and respond to important business queries using available datasets (such as those from Kaggle, the UN, the US government, etc.)
Effectively communicate with the researchers to comprehend the needs and provide the results


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming
Strong data analytic abilities and business sense are required to draw the appropriate conclusions from the dataset, respond to those conclusions, and clearly convey the key findings
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Excellent communication abilities to work with stakeholders and researchers successfully
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills

Title: Data Scientist Intern (second semester)
Description:
Doing an internship at delaware

delaware believes in giving young professionals every chance to find out what and who they want to become. That’s why we have an extensive internship program in place. If you are looking for an internship to complete your studies and put theory into practice, then you’ve found it!




What do we offer you during a Data Science internship at delaware?

Full ownership of your own project: you are in charge and decide how you tackle the challenge. In the end, you’ll be the expert on your internship topic and our colleagues will be happy to hear your thoughts.
A lot of learning and dedicated guidance by a team of consultants.
An innovation project that brings actual value to us or our customers. As an intern, you won’t be running back and forth to the coffee machine.
Most importantly: a fun work environment with awesome colleagues, team events and ‘koffiekoeken’ on Mondays.




What team will you be part of?

You’ll join a dynamic team that is passionate about transforming data into actionable insights and driving data-driven decision-making. More specifically our Data Science team which works with advanced data models, machine learning algorithms, and modern digital platforms, leveraging SAP technologies to help organizations innovate and optimize their processes. We have a team of over 40 enthusiastic, eager professionals living and breathing data.




Our spear point solutions are:

· Machine Learning & GenAI: Leveraging cutting-edge techniques to automate processes, optimize business performance, and solve complex business problems.

Predictive Analytics: Empowering businesses to make data-backed predictions and informed decisions.
Data Modeling & Engineering: Building robust data architectures that ensure clean, usable, and scalable data pipelines.
Visualization & Reporting: Turning complex data sets into intuitive visualizations that drive insight-driven business strategies.
Business Platform: Data is the fuel, propelling intelligent technologies forward with ML, optimizing processes & solving business problems




What will you be doing as an intern?

As an intern at delaware, you’ll have the opportunity to immerse yourself in the world of data science. Here’s what you’ll be working on:

SAP Technologies: Get hands-on experience with SAP technologies, which are at the core of our solutions. You’ll learn how to use these tools to gather, manage your AI pipelines and visualize data.
Project Ownership: You will lead your own data science project, from defining the problem and gathering the data to building models and delivering results.
Data Analysis & Modeling: You’ll work with large datasets, applying machine learning algorithms, statistical methods, and advanced analytics to extract meaningful insights.
Tools & methodologies: Gain hands-on experience with industry-standard tools and methodologies, such as MLOps, CI/CD, SAP AI Core, SAP AI Launchpad, Python, Docker, SQL, YAML. You’ll develop skills in data preparation, feature engineering, and model evaluation.
Collaboration: Work alongside data scientists and consultants to tackle real-world business challenges and provide valuable insights to clients.




Are we a match?

· You are currently pursuing a master’s degree in data science, computer science, engineering, statistics or a related field.

· You master data science programming languages such as python.

· You can complete your internship in the second semester.

· You’re able to work from our Wavre office

· You are fluent in English and French

· You have a keen interest in data science and are excited to learn new tools, techniques, and approaches.

· You are motivated, eager to learn, and ready to develop both your technical and communication skills to interact with stakeholders.




Then you're the data science intern we need!

Show more

Title: Python Developer
HTML:
Toloka AI is a global tech company that offers end-to-end AI solutions based on the effective combination of Crowd+ML+Expert+Tech Platform. Our solutions are powered by the most diverse global crowd from 100+ countries speaking 40+ languages.


We bring together experts from all over the world to form our growing team of more than 200 people. Our team is globally distributed and works from several locations, including the USA, the Netherlands, Israel, Czech Republic, Serbia, and more. Working at Toloka unlocks the door to being able to work on global projects and our commitment to personal and professional growth.


Toloka AI’s Machine Learning and Data Platform (MLDP) is, without exaggeration, a key part of Toloka’s success. The platform can be represented as a suite of tools and services designed to support the entire machine learning lifecycle, from data preprocessing to model deployment, management, and serving.


We are looking for an experienced Python developer (with a background of ML and Dev-/MLops as a benefit) who can help us make our platform even better.


Responsibilities


  • Develop ML infrastructure, for example, backend for LLM inference and training (mostly GPU);
  • Automate data and ml pipelines;
  • Implement new open-source tools for our internal clients;
  • Maintain the platform;
  • Develop technical documentation;
  • Gather requirements from our internal ML teams and offer optimal solution balancing different use cases;
  • Be the part highly skilled MLOps engineers.


Requirements


  • 5+ years experience as Software Engineer (primary python);
  • Experience in infrastructure or backend development;
  • Interest in working on internal infrastructure and ML Ops;
  • Ability to design solutions and maintain ML infrastructure;
  • English language - B2 or higher.


Requirements +


  • Understanding of instruments and practices for LLM training and inferencing;
  • Experience with ML infrastructure;
  • Familiar with popular DevOps tools: Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform;
  • Knowledge of how to work with Spark (Databricks);
  • Experience in working with Airflow (or there's ETL orchestration tools) and DBT.


Tools and technologies


  • MLFlow, Huggingface, vLLM, databricks, airflow, dbt, montecarlo, tableau, Microsoft Azure, Airbyte, k8s, terraform and a lot of custom self-developed tools.


What we can offer


  • Personal and career development: we support employee’s ambition for professional development and encourage them to implement their ideas in their projects;
  • Flexibility: we offer remote or hybrid employment. You will also design with your manager a workday that works best for you;
  • Paid parental leave + Annual vacation policy;
  • Transportation expenses reimbursement;
  • Contributions to personal pension plan.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
What can you expect?

Python Predictions is currently looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer. In this role, you will need to be able to adapt quickly to new technologies, applications and environments. You will operate with our current clients on a medium to long-term basis.

As an ML Engineer, you will help our clients building and serving machine learning models. More specifically, the responsibilities include:

Design and implement solutions to serve machine learning models, from traditional ML to Generative AI.
Train, improve, and deploy ML models.
Write production ready code and serve online, batch, and real time models
Identify, design, and implement process improvements in the machine learning lifecylce: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-design infrastructure for greater scalability, etc
Collaborate with Data Scientists, MLOps Engineers and Data Engineers, to integrate all parts of the solution.
Coach colleagues and clients in your area of expertise







Who are we looking for?

Required

Master or PhD in Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Engineering, or related field.
At least 3 years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, Data Scientist, MLOps Engineer, or in a similar position.
Strong software engineering background
Experience deploying machine learning in production
Experience with experiment tracking, models monitoring, and deployment strategies
Ability to write production ready code in Python.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and understanding of Infrastructure as Code
Knowledge of containers and container orchestration.
Master software engineering best practices and software release cycle.
Solid understanding of Linux and in depth knowledge of at least one cloud provider.
Knowledge of big data technologies such as Apache Spark, Kafka.
Able to coach others and give technical advice and direction.Experience building, scheduling and maintaining ML pipelines
Able to work independently, prioritize multiple stakeholders and tasks, and manage work time effectively
Proficient in English, knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus







What do we have to offer?

Python Predictions is a Brussels-based service provider specialized in data projects with business impact
In January 2020, Python Predictions joined Tobania – a leading Belgian business & technology consulting. And in turn, in March 2023, Tobania joined Sopra Steria – a major Tech player in Europe recognized for its consulting, digital services and software development
Great variation in job content due to missions in different industries, different domains and different environments
In-company training adapted to your personal needs
Continuous learning in monthly team meetings and personal development time
A great team of colleagues with shared values

Discover our Tobania galaxy

Title: Data Engineer / Data Scientist Internship
Description:
At VALKUREN, we are looking for a driven and creative Data Engineer/Data Scientist intern to come up with solutions, tools, and processes to bring innovation to our young and dynamic team.




Responsibilities

You will work closely with one of our seniors to participate in the solutions’ development and implementation depending on the business case of the moment. You will work either directly for one of our customers, managed by a member of our team, or for one of our internal projects.




In particular, as a Data Engineer/Data Scientist , you will participate in all the different phases of a project:

Definition of specifications (functional & technical)
Development and Implementation of the solution (architecture, data processing, data modelling, machine learning, prediction, analysis, artificial intelligence [AI] services, etc.) in an agile way of working, with a close collaboration with the business
Organize & manage workshops
Meeting minutes and documentation




Thanks to a varied program and an analytically demanding position, you will continue to challenge yourself increasingly.




Qualifications

*** Only EU student covered by internship convention***

Hard skills

Ideally at the end of a computer science master or equivalent (certification or training program)
Basic experience (scholar or professional) in data engineering and data science: data connector, APIs, processing, integration, transformation, etc
Understanding of solutions built or employed in a Big Data environment
Ability to participate in solutions’ development and implementation along with the Data Scientists
Advanced programming knowledge
First contact with some analytics module (e.g. Power BI) is an asset
First experience with a git tool and Azure, AWS or GCP is also an asset
Ability to speak "French or Dutch" AND English

Soft skills

Motivation to solve problems and intellectual curiosity
Communicative skills
Team player with a sense of autonomy
Creativity and innovation
AI lover !




Offer

Expenses: lunch package (8 euro/day) and travel expenses (transport subscription or kms)
Provision of a laptop and all tools necessary for the data science tasks
Real experience acquired in a project environment within a small team working in start-up mode in a nice environment in the heart of Brussels
2 days remote possible

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Your mission :

Join Partenamut, Belgium's first free, French-speaking mutual insurance company, and embark on a professional and personal journey where people are at the heart of everything. Here, we are ready to build the mutuality of tomorrow even more attentive and innovative. Every day, we support more than 1.3 million customers in proactively managing their health, but above all, we form a collaborative and supportive team. Your talents and individuality are freely expressed to achieve our common goals.

We believe in human-centred fulfilment, innovation, solidarity and diversity. If you're passionate about innovation and people, if you're prepared to go the extra mile for our customers while remaining whole, and if you like to challenge yourself at work while enjoying your free time, we look forward to meeting you so that together we can build the health and well-being of tomorrow.




Your responsabilities :

Daily :

You process and combine structured and unstructured data from various natures to develop innovative solutions solving identified business needs and opening new possibilities.
You evaluate, validate and productize your developments, in collaboration with relevant colleagues.
You exchange with your squad members (PO, Data Engineers, Data Analysts, RPA) to make sure the solutions are meeting the business needs and are efficiently implemented. You actively take part in the (agile) life of the squad.
You collaborate with other colleagues according to the needs (architect, DPO, DevOps, business…). This way you ensure your developments are compliant, you grow the knowledge of colleagues and you identify new opportunities.
You contribute to the continuous improvement of the team's way of working, by defining and insuring the use of good practices in diverse areas such as Documentation, (ML)Ops, Software Engineering, Monitoring, collaboration…
You have fun collaborating with amazing colleagues and discussing fascinating (non-)work related topics.




Your profile as a senior Data Scientist :

You have a Master’s degree or a PhD, preferably in Computer Science, Mathematics or Data Science. Anyway, independently of your background, you have a big affinity with Data and IT, together with a strong analytical mindset.
You have at least 7 years of experience working as a Data Scientist / ML Engineer, and at least 3 years of experience extracting information from unstructured data (text and image). In particular, you have successfully deployed Large Language Models to solve actual business problems.
You are fully comfortable with the main ML/AI principles and algorithms and have experience developing ML models from structured data as well.
You have experience developing and maintaining such assets on AWS. You are fluent in Python. Knowledge of SQL is an asset. Practical experience of implementing MLOps good practices is a strong asset.
You have a strong work ethic, can work autonomously as well as collaborating with colleagues from various backgrounds (data engineering, data translators, data analysts) You are not afraid of being proactive regarding the choice of a technical solution or the proposal of new directions to explore. In other words, you contribute to our team objective of being an inspiration force for our colleagues and the company.
Next to your technical skills, you love solving actual problems. You are creative but pragmatic regarding the use of AI and are also able to explain complex topics in clear and simple terms. You are also curious about latest developments in the field of AI.
You have English and French full business proficiency. Dutch is an asset.
You don't tick all checkboxes, but you are a quick learner and are confident you can soon catch up.




Our offer :

A full-time open-ended contract with flexible working hours and the possibility of remote working up to 3 days a week.
An exciting position with real prospects in a fast-growing company.
In-depth training in the mutual insurance sector on arrival and regular training throughout your career.
An attractive salary with numerous non-statutory benefits that can be adapted to suit your needs.
Up to 46 days of leave per year.

Merci de noter qu’aucune candidature envoyée par un bureau de consultance externe ne sera acceptée si le bureau n’a pas été expressément mandaté pour cette recherche par Partenamut.

Title: Mid-Level Data Scientist - Financial Services
Description:
***Work permit for Belgium is required for this position***




About the role:

We are seeking a talented and motivated Data Scientist Consultant with 3-5 years of experience to join our growing team. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work on challenging and impactful projects for our banking and financial services clients. You will also contribute to internal initiatives focused on building AI solutions to expand the company’s offering.




About Sailpeak:

Sailpeak is a Brussels-based consulting firm specializing in guiding Banking & Insurance firms through the complexities of digital transformation. With expertise in Business Strategy, Data & AI, and Digital Transformation, Sailpeak helps clients navigate the ever-evolving landscape and reach new heights of success.




Role and Responsibilities:

Client Consulting:

Partner with banking clients to identify and address their most pressing data-driven challenges.
Design, develop, and implement machine learning models to tackle a variety of use cases, such as risk assessment, fraud detection, customer churn prediction, and more.
Apply your expertise in AI, LLMs, and chatbot technologies to elevate client solutions.
Communicate complex technical concepts clearly and concisely to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Internal Projects:

Spearhead the development of a comprehensive methodology and toolset for evaluating AI chatbot quality.
Stay at the forefront of chatbot quality assurance advancements through research and exploration.
Collaborate with internal teams to integrate and refine chatbot assessment processes.




Requirements:

Education:

Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related quantitative field.

Experience:

3-5 years of hands-on experience in data science, ideally within the banking or financial services sector.

Technical Skills:

Strong proficiency in Python and key machine learning libraries (scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Expertise in AI, LLM, and chatbot technologies.
Familiarity with MLOps practices for model deployment and management.
Excellent data visualization and communication skills.

Language Skills:

Fluent in English, French, and Dutch.

Other Skills:

Experience with Scrum or Agile methods is a plus.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Passion for continuous learning and keeping up with the latest developments in AI and data science.




What We Offer:

A competitive salary and benefits package.
The opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects with leading banking clients.
Exposure to a wide array of AI and data science technologies.
Mentorship and support from Directors and Partners with backgrounds from renowned companies like Google, PayPal, Semetis, and Sia Partners.
A dynamic and collaborative work environment.




Interested?

Are you ready to embark on a rewarding career in management consulting with Sailpeak? To apply for this role, kindly send the following to careers@sailpeak.com:

Your up-to-date CV/resume.
A cover letter outlining your interest in the role and your pertinent qualifications.
Details of any academic or professional accomplishments or projects.




Set your course toward a transformative career at Sailpeak today!

hello,

Strong expertise in Python and experience with deploying applications and setting them in production.

Title: MLOps Engineer
Description:
Job Description

At Telenet we are driven by the ambition to integrate machine learning and AI across all facets of our operations, strategic decision-making, and communication channels. In pursuit of this vision, we are actively seeking talented MLOps Engineers to help transform the ML models created by our Data Scientists into sustained business value.

As a Junior MLOps Engineer, you will combine your Data Engineering expertise, DevOps skills, and affinity with machine learning to deploy and maintain ML / Data Science systems in production, while improving the maturity of the related operational processes and frameworks. You will also collaborate closely with our Data Scientists, offering technical guidance in model development and supporting them with templates and reusable components.

Your Responsibilities As An MLOps Engineer


Industrialization of ML models and data features developed by Data Scientists
Development & maintenance of framework and templates for model industrialization, supporting both batch scoring and live inference
Development & maintenance of our Analytics Feature Store that serves as main source of information for ML models and ad hoc analyses
Model and data quality monitoring - check availability and quality of model scores and feature values, spot and analyze issues, communicate to data scientists and Business stakeholders and ensure that problems get resolved swiftly
Build and maintain a library of reusable components to facilitate and standardize model development and boost the efficiency of the Data Scientists
Closely collaborate with Data Scientists during model development to offer technical guidance


Our ideal MLOps Engineer ..

MLOps Engineers form the bridge between data science and data engineering and should therefore have a good mix of competencies from both worlds. However, we do not expect candidates to already meet all the requirements listed below. So, if you identify with the majority of the following attributes, don’t hesitate to apply!


Master’s degree with a focus on computer science/informatics/machine learning (or equivalent)
Good knowledge of either Machine Learning Engineering, Data Engineering, or DevOps, and at least basic knowledge of the other domains. Working experience in any of these domains is a plus
Good knowledge of programming and query languages (Python, PySpark, SQL), where familiarity with Python libraries commonly used in scientific computing and machine learning (pandas, scikit-learn, pytorch, etc.) is a plus
Familiarity with the AWS Cloud environment (and AWS Sagemaker in particular), Snowflake and/or dbt are not strictly required, but definitely an added value
Hands-on experience with Git
A problem-solving mindset, strong self-discipline and willingness to take ownership of the operational health and reliability of our ML models
Team player with good communication skills to interact with data scientists and be the first point of contact for Business stakeholders in case of issues or questions
Willingness to learn and curiosity for new technologies and innovation
Fluent English speaker


What We Offer


Start a new adventure in an innovative, healthy and ambitious organization that aims to become an (inter)national frontrunner in leveraging AI and machine learning.
Enjoy flexible working hours and the freedom to work from home (3 days per week) or in our open and trendy collaboration spots at the office
Work in a state-of-the-art AWS Cloud environment
We’ll coach you, train you and make you part of our story. You’ll have access to an extensive training catalogue and external platforms such as Datacamp and Linkedin Learning, and ample opportunity to learn on the job
An agile organization that stimulates personal growth, internal mobility and the possibility to change roles
Join a team of young, dynamic, enthusiastic and results-driven data profiles, with fun team buildings, on-site padel games and the occasional afterwork drinks
Enjoy an attractive compensation & benefits package, including a company car, meal vouchers, group and health insurance, a yearly bonus and discounts on Telenet products.
Show more

Title: (Gen) AI and Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
As Stephen Few states: “We are overwhelmed by information, not because there is too much, but because we haven't learned how to tame it.” Capgemini Insights & Data is looking for people who tame data in such a way that the most complex data can be easily interpreted.




We are looking for a (GEN) AI and Machine Learning Engineer to help our clients in their digital transformations.




Key tasks & activities

Use ML and Generative AI tools and other technologies to design, evangelize, and implement state-of-the-art solutions for never-before-solved problems.
Define and implement best practices for building, testing, and deploying scalable AI solutions, with a focus on generative models and LLM.
Drive successful business outcomes for educating, training, designing and building cloud hosted Generative AI solutions
Interact with customers directly to understand the business problem, help and aid them in implementation of their ML ecosystem
Educate customers on the value proposition of GenAI and showcase the art of possible.
Participate in deep architectural discussions and design exercises to create solutions while ensuring solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud.
Stay at the forefront of AI technological advancements, especially in Generative AI and LLM, and assess their applicability to our business needs.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, AI/ML & data engineers, and functional SMEs, to ensure seamless integration and alignment of AI solutions with business objectives. influence the technical viability of the architecture of AI projects, ensuring optimal performance, scalability, and integration.
Develop Solutions to ensure robust and secure data pipelines and infrastructure to support AI model training and deployment.
Lead the evaluation of new AI tools, frameworks, and methodologies, advocating for the adoption of technologies that align with our strategic goals.




Knowledge & Experience

Experience in leveraging artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies to optimize and transform various aspects of our business operations.
Minimum of 4 years of experience in designing and building AI solutions, with a strong focus on end-to-end automation.
Proven expertise in machine learning techniques, deep learning frameworks, image processing and AI-related technologies including Generative AI.
Experience with one of the cloud platforms, preferably Azure
Experience with Python or PySpark.
Experience in using Data Science Platforms
Experience using the latest Data Science platforms (e.g. Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker ) and frameworks (e.g. Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn )
Good understanding of software architecture patterns & application development.
Familiarity with DevOps,DataOps,MLOps, LLMOps principles including code repository, code management, CI/CD and AI-related automation.
Strong communication skills for both presenting work to clients, disseminating complex information in an easy-to-understand form on a day-to-day basis, and managing stakeholders.
Native speaker in Dutch or French with professional working proficiency in English.




#GetTheFutureYouWant




At Capgemini, we believe in diversity, equal opportunities, and a workplace where everyone feels valued. We take good care of people and help them make progress by assigning challenging projects and providing ample opportunities for personal growth and learning. We are looking for experienced professionals ready for their next career move.

You will join the I&D team, an ambitious, collaborative, supportive environment—problem-solvers with a strong focus on exchanging best practices to deliver exceptional results with Data science. Here, the knowledge of each team member and their own expertise is valuable to enable effective decision-making, proactive planning, and smooth project execution.




In return, we offer an attractive salary with fringe benefits:

A hybrid or electric company car (or mobility budget)
Meal & eco vouchers
Group & health insurance
Flexible work hours & the opportunity to work from home (70% of the time)
32 vacation days & 45 workcation days (to work abroad)
Intensive training and certification at all levels to keep you up to date with the latest trends & technologies




Apply now! We'd love to hear from you.




For more information: contact liz.nzimbula@capgemini.com or visit www.capgemini.com

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
What can you expect?

Python Predictions is currently looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer. In this role, you will need to be able to adapt quickly to new technologies, applications and environments. You will operate with our current clients on a medium to long-term basis.

As an ML Engineer, you will help our clients building and serving machine learning models. More specifically, the responsibilities include:

Design and implement solutions to serve machine learning models, from traditional ML to Generative AI.
Train, improve, and deploy ML models.
Write production ready code and serve online, batch, and real time models
Identify, design, and implement process improvements in the machine learning lifecylce: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-design infrastructure for greater scalability, etc
Collaborate with Data Scientists, MLOps Engineers and Data Engineers, to integrate all parts of the solution.
Coach colleagues and clients in your area of expertise







Who are we looking for?

Required

Master or PhD in Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Engineering, or related field.
At least 3 years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, Data Scientist, MLOps Engineer, or in a similar position.
Strong software engineering background
Experience deploying machine learning in production
Experience with experiment tracking, models monitoring, and deployment strategies
Ability to write production ready code in Python.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and understanding of Infrastructure as Code
Knowledge of containers and container orchestration.
Master software engineering best practices and software release cycle.
Solid understanding of Linux and in depth knowledge of at least one cloud provider.
Knowledge of big data technologies such as Apache Spark, Kafka.
Able to coach others and give technical advice and direction.Experience building, scheduling and maintaining ML pipelines
Able to work independently, prioritize multiple stakeholders and tasks, and manage work time effectively
Proficient in English, knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus







What do we have to offer?

Python Predictions is a Brussels-based service provider specialized in data projects with business impact
In January 2020, Python Predictions joined Tobania – a leading Belgian business & technology consulting. And in turn, in March 2023, Tobania joined Sopra Steria – a major Tech player in Europe recognized for its consulting, digital services and software development
Great variation in job content due to missions in different industries, different domains and different environments
In-company training adapted to your personal needs
Continuous learning in monthly team meetings and personal development time
A great team of colleagues with shared values

Discover our Tobania galaxy

Are you ready to embark on a rewarding career in management consulting with Sailpeak? To apply for this role, kindly send the following to careers@sailpeak.com:

  • Your up-to-date CV/resume.
  • A cover letter outlining your interest in the role and your pertinent qualifications.
  • Details of any academic or professional accomplishments or projects.


Set your course toward a transformative career at Sailpeak today!

Title: ML engineer / Data Scientist Python
Description:
hello,

I am currently looking for a skilled ML Engineer / Data Scientist Python with minimum 4 years of experience for one of my clients in the financial sector. The ideal candidate should possess the following skills:

Strong expertise in Python and experience with deploying applications and setting them in production.
Proficiency in CI/CD processes and delivering applications.
Experience with GitLab and Jenkins.
Familiarity with Ansible for deployment, and ideally, knowledge of running an Ansible Tower.
Competence in testing using Pytest and Rust.
Fluent in English and French or Dutch is a plus.



The client offers a remote work policy, allowing you to work remotely 50% of the time.



Feel free to apply with your Updated CV.

Kinds regards,
