Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Your mission :

Join Partenamut, Belgium's first free, French-speaking mutual insurance company, and embark on a professional and personal journey where people are at the heart of everything. Here, we are ready to build the mutuality of tomorrow even more attentive and innovative. Every day, we support more than 1.3 million customers in proactively managing their health, but above all, we form a collaborative and supportive team. Your talents and individuality are freely expressed to achieve our common goals.

We believe in human-centred fulfilment, innovation, solidarity and diversity. If you're passionate about innovation and people, if you're prepared to go the extra mile for our customers while remaining whole, and if you like to challenge yourself at work while enjoying your free time, we look forward to meeting you so that together we can build the health and well-being of tomorrow.




Your responsabilities :

Daily :

You process and combine structured and unstructured data from various natures to develop innovative solutions solving identified business needs and opening new possibilities.
You evaluate, validate and productize your developments, in collaboration with relevant colleagues.
You exchange with your squad members (PO, Data Engineers, Data Analysts, RPA) to make sure the solutions are meeting the business needs and are efficiently implemented. You actively take part in the (agile) life of the squad.
You collaborate with other colleagues according to the needs (architect, DPO, DevOps, business…). This way you ensure your developments are compliant, you grow the knowledge of colleagues and you identify new opportunities.
You contribute to the continuous improvement of the team's way of working, by defining and insuring the use of good practices in diverse areas such as Documentation, (ML)Ops, Software Engineering, Monitoring, collaboration…
You have fun collaborating with amazing colleagues and discussing fascinating (non-)work related topics.




Your profile as a senior Data Scientist :

You have a Master’s degree or a PhD, preferably in Computer Science, Mathematics or Data Science. Anyway, independently of your background, you have a big affinity with Data and IT, together with a strong analytical mindset.
You have at least 7 years of experience working as a Data Scientist / ML Engineer, and at least 3 years of experience extracting information from unstructured data (text and image). In particular, you have successfully deployed Large Language Models to solve actual business problems.
You are fully comfortable with the main ML/AI principles and algorithms and have experience developing ML models from structured data as well.
You have experience developing and maintaining such assets on AWS. You are fluent in Python. Knowledge of SQL is an asset. Practical experience of implementing MLOps good practices is a strong asset.
You have a strong work ethic, can work autonomously as well as collaborating with colleagues from various backgrounds (data engineering, data translators, data analysts) You are not afraid of being proactive regarding the choice of a technical solution or the proposal of new directions to explore. In other words, you contribute to our team objective of being an inspiration force for our colleagues and the company.
Next to your technical skills, you love solving actual problems. You are creative but pragmatic regarding the use of AI and are also able to explain complex topics in clear and simple terms. You are also curious about latest developments in the field of AI.
You have English and French full business proficiency. Dutch is an asset.
You don't tick all checkboxes, but you are a quick learner and are confident you can soon catch up.




Our offer :

A full-time open-ended contract with flexible working hours and the possibility of remote working up to 3 days a week.
An exciting position with real prospects in a fast-growing company.
In-depth training in the mutual insurance sector on arrival and regular training throughout your career.
An attractive salary with numerous non-statutory benefits that can be adapted to suit your needs.
Up to 46 days of leave per year.

Merci de noter qu’aucune candidature envoyée par un bureau de consultance externe ne sera acceptée si le bureau n’a pas été expressément mandaté pour cette recherche par Partenamut.

Title: Junior Engineer
Description:
Sia Partners is a specialist Management Consulting firm created in 1999 and has grown into a global firm with approximately 2800 employees and annual revenue exceeding $400m. Our culture is strongly orientated towards high-quality expertise and delivering excellent results and outcomes for our clients, which include a wide range of multinational companies. Our global presence and our expertise in more than 40 sectors and services allows us to accompany clients worldwide. Using innovative technologies such as our own in-house apps, social networks, and digital tools, we provide a truly integrated global service.


Through Consulting for Good, we put our expertise at the service of our clients' climate objectives and make sustainable development a performance lever for our clients. Our portfolio of offerings is cross-sectors and 17 % of our revenue is generated from engagements with a CSR focus.




Job Description



Sia Partners is looking for bright and dynamic junior enigneer committed to building relationships and delivering results. We are interested in people with good track records during their education and, preferably, with a first successful and relevant job experience. We believe in people we hire, so we encourage you to take up responsibility as fast as possible. Your personal growth is our goal.


As an engineer consultant, you will be involved in transformation projects at our clients. You will execute project assignments, including intelligent data structuring, data analysis, benchmarks, interviews, workshop animation, process mapping, functional specifications, etc. As fast as possible, you will take up team support roles. You will get the opportunity to contribute actively to our knowledge creation and exchange (workshops, publications, seminars,…) within the business units of the different industries we serve.


Equipped with the entrepreneurial fibre, you are ready to collaborate with us in a fast growing company.




Qualifications


University Master Civil Engineering or Business Engineering
0 to 3 years’ experience as a consultant
Outstanding collaborative team player and good communication skills
Strong interest in Energy
Analytical mind, exploring options and able to synthesize into conclusions
Autonomous, dynamic, result oriented, rigorous and committed
Languages: Trilingual French, Dutch and English.
Prepared to participate in temporary assignments abroad (e.g. France, The Netherlands)


Additional Information



We are unable to provide a work permit for this position


Sia Partners is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.


Sia Partners is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
I'm working with a scale-up Brussels-based FinTech company, harnessing the power of AI to revolutionize financial solutions.

By offering intelligent, data-driven services, they are redefining the way financial products are designed and delivered. With a focus on innovation, they are rapidly growing and looking for skilled developers to drive their vision forward.




They're offering a fully remote role, with the option to work from new satellite offices in Brussels and Ghent when you please.

All candidates must be based in Belgium and have a valid working permit.




The Role

As a Python Developer, you will be an essential part of the technical team, working on AI-enhanced financial solutions. You will primarily use Python to develop back-end services, while experience in Golang and Django is a plus.

You’ll also get the chance to work with TypeScript, and any knowledge of React will be a valuable bonus as the company continues to build robust, user-friendly platforms.




Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain scalable, efficient back-end services using Python
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate front-end components, ideally using TypeScript and React
Design and implement APIs and data pipelines
Contribute to the development of new features, ensuring high quality and performance
Stay updated with the latest advancements in Python, AI, and FinTech technologies




Requirements:

Strong experience with Python and (Django and Golang would be a bonus)
Proficiency in TypeScript (React knowledge is a bonus)
Experience building and integrating APIs and back-end services
Familiarity with cloud platforms and DevOps practices is beneficial
Strong communication skills in English (Dutch is a plus)




Benefits:

Being a part of an ever-growing company, with the chance for rapid promotions
Work remotely, or from their new satellite offices in Brussels and Ghent
Up to €6,500 gross for experienced applicants
Full benefits package including an option for a company car
Flexible working hours with a strong emphasis on work-life balance
Inclusive and international working dynamic
Collaborate with a team of experts in AI, FinTech, and software development




If you’re a Python Developer excited about working with AI solutions in a fast-growing FinTech company, apply today!

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together

Job Description

We have an opening for a person with a passion for data science & AI, interested in solving concrete business projects in a wide variety of domains and applications.

In this role, you will work closely with other Data Profiles from Sopra Steria but also from our clients’ internal teams. You will lead the way and participate in multiple advanced analytics & AI projects from the ideation phase to the value delivery. Every step of the way, you will ensure the quality of the analytical solution as well as the actionability towards the business stakeholders.

Does this sound like your ideal day-to-day drill? Then don’t wait any longer and let’s meet.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!

You’ll have knowledge and experience of the following:


You have multiple years of industry experience in building and delivering a variety of data science & AI applications / solutions
You understand that organizations today should make the most of the available information, in order to turn this information into value. You have acquired relevant skills through your past experiences
You are proficient in Python (all other programming languages are a plus).
You have worked on at least one cloud provider
You are motivated by obtaining concrete deliverables and results. You want to make a difference for the organizations you work for, and you like to be recognized for your input
You can work independently, but you also appreciate collaboration. You are open-minded and have no fear of expressing your opinion in a constructive way
You are proficient in English, knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus
Experience in project management and people management is a plus


What We Can Offer You

As a member of one of Europe’s largest digital solutions providers, you’ll benefit from extensive career development opportunities, both local and international. At the Sopra Steria Academy, you’ll be part of a dynamic network of 56,000 professionals at all stages of their careers. With a wide array of offices to explore, you can find your ideal location and take the next step in your career.

You’ll become a part of a major Tech player in Europe recognised for its consulting, digital services, and software development. On top of that, you’ll join our Data & AI team, where we support enterprises and institutions to become more data driven, and assist our clients to increase business efficiency and create impact with data. We offer a complete portfolio of Services and Solutions to unburden organisations in every step of their transition: from defining and executing the data strategy and governance, over setting up data platforms, to visualizing dashboards and applying the latest data science and artificial intelligence methodologies.

Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.
Show more

Title: Ormit Talent - Data Traineeship
Description:
Always had a thing for data? Time for the next step then. And go from curious data lover to curious data chief. In various roles at one or more companies. As a data analyst, data translator, business analyst, junior data scientist, ...




Because data is the new gold. If you know how to turn them into insights. That’s why more and more companies are investing in data. And in people who know how to handle them.







How special are you? Do the test.

You say oui and ja. You speak fluently French or Dutch. With a B1 level for the other.
A big passion for data is a big must. You don't need to be an expert in data just yet. We’ll help you become one. Just show us your affinity and above all: your passion!
Data tools are your middle name. Excel has no secrets for you, and other tools like Python, SQL or PowerBI sound familiar too. You just love to dive into all possible data tools.
You have a master or bachelor degree in a data-oriented field. Think civil or business engineering, mathematics, computer science, applied economics, statistics, IT,…
Or max 3 years work experience in analytics or a job filled with projects that triggered your passion for data, digital and tech.
You are curious (relentlessly). You want to know everything about as many things as possible. And if you don’t know it, you want to learn it. Comfort zones are a joke to you.







What’s in it for you? A killer combo of data and people skills

Discover your data thing: Find out which part you want to play in the data universe (and at which company). By doing and learning. And with our help.
Challenging projects: Switch roles, teams, companies and industries. In advanced data analytics, processing, project management, business analytics, … The common thread: data.
Boost your skills: Get ready to be amused and amazed with +20 tailored training days on data and people skills. Where you learn how to translate data into business reality.
Learn from senior experts: Who support and coach you during your assignments. And gladly share their knowledge on data and people skills with you.
Build connections : All those teams and companies, no wonder you’re left with a tremendous network. Not to mention your fellow special ones (and BFF’s).
Land in your dream job: Is there life after this traineeship? Absolutely! As a future proof data expert. And who knows, maybe even chief data officer ...
Enjoy the ride: Be part of a tight group of special ones. Instantly. Who you bond with for years to come. Thanks to our many events, workshops or during running.







How to become a data chief?

Discover in trainings how data skills (advanced analytics, functional analysis, visualisation, …) and people skills (communication, self-leadership, …) form a killer combo in your everyday work.
Work in data analytics, data management, data processing, business analytics, project management, data science, …
And then grow even further thanks to personal coaching and data mentoring







Ask us!

We bet you still have a lot of questions or could use our help. Tell us who you are and what you're looking for. One of our recruiters will get in touch.

Contact our recruiters : recruitment@ormittalent.be

Show more

  • Build connections : All those teams and companies, no wonder you’re left with a tremendous network. Not to mention your fellow special ones (and BFF’s).
  • Land in your dream job: Is there life after this traineeship? Absolutely! As a future proof data expert. And who knows, maybe even chief data officer ...
  • Enjoy the ride: Be part of a tight group of special ones. Instantly. Who you bond with for years to come. Thanks to our many events, workshops or during running.



How to become a data chief?

  • Discover in trainings how data skills (advanced analytics, functional analysis, visualisation, …) and people skills (communication, self-leadership, …) form a killer combo in your everyday work.
  • Work in data analytics, data management, data processing, business analytics, project management, data science, …
  • And then grow even further thanks to personal coaching and data mentoring



Ask us!

We bet you still have a lot of questions or could use our help. Tell us who you are and what you're looking for. One of our recruiters will get in touch.

Contact our recruiters : recruitment@ormittalent.be

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Your responsibilities and skills include:

Contributing to the design and implementation of the Azure data platform.
Developing and deploying end-to-end data applications using the Azure data platform.
Demonstrating experience with Azure data analytics services such as Data Factory, ADLS, Synapse, SQL Server, Databricks, and ML.
Proficiency in data technologies like Spark, Python/Pandas, and SQL.
Applying knowledge of modern software engineering practices and tools (e.g., Git, CI/CD, testing, Pipelines, Bitbucket, Jenkins, Azure DevOps).
Familiarity with Infrastructure-as-Code tools such as Terraform.
Collaborating with Data Architects and Platform Architects to ensure alignment with requirements and architecture.
Coordinating with Security & Infrastructure teams to ensure data assets and products are well-integrated and secure.
Working independently, effectively managing priorities across multiple stakeholders and tasks.
Contributing to the establishment of standards, guidelines, and best practices, ensuring adherence to them.
Staying informed of the latest trends and technologies, and assessing their potential impact on your work.

Show more

Title: Ormit Talent - Data Traineeship
Description:
Altijd al iets met data gehad? Doe er dan iets mee. En ga van curious data talent naar curious data chief. In verschillende rollen bij één of meerdere bedrijven. Als data analyst, data translator, business analyst, junior data scientist, …




Want data is het nieuwe goud. Als je ze weet om te zetten naar inzichten, tenminste. Daarom investeren steeds meer bedrijven in data. En in mensen die er hun weg in weten te vinden.







Hoe speciaal ben jij al? Doe de test.

Een grote passie voor data is een must. Een data expert moet je nog niet zijn. Daar helpen wij je wel bij. Toon ons je huidige skills en vooral: je passie!
Data tools zijn je 2e naam. Excel heeft geen geheimen voor jou. En ook tools als Python, SQL of PowerBI klinken je bekend in de oren. Je houdt er eigenlijk simpelweg van om in alle mogelijke data tools te duiken!
Ja, oui, yes. Je zegt het allemaal! Je spreekt vlot Engels (C1) en Frans/Nederlands (C2) met een B1 in het andere.
Je hebt een master of bachelor met een focus op data en analytics. Denk aan richtingen zoals (industrieel, burgerlijk, handels-), IT, data, economie, wiskunde, statistiek, …
Of max 3 jaar werkervaring. In analytics of een job vol projecten die je passie voor data, digitaal en technologie aangewakkerd hebben.
Je bent nieuwsgierig. Je wilt over bijna alles zoveel mogelijk weten. En graag alles of toch heel veel kunnen. Comfort zones, daar lach je eens mee.







What’s in it for you? Een killer combinatie tussen data en people skills.

Ontdek jouw data ding. Ontdek welke rol jij wil spelen in het data universum (en bij wie je dat het liefste zou doen). Door te doen en te leren. En met onze hulp.
Uitdagende projecten. Switch tussen rollen, teams, bedrijven en sectoren. In advanced data analytics, processing, project management, business analytics, … Rode draad: data!
Geef je skills een boost. Maak je klaar om verrast en geïnspireerd te worden in +20 trainingsdagen rond data an people skills. Waar je leert hoe data écht te vertalen naar business realiteit.
Leer van senior experten. Die je ondersteunen en coachen tijdens je opdrachten. En hun kennis over data en people skills met je delen.
Bouw connecties. Al die teams en bedrijven, logisch dat je daar een stevig netwerk aan overhoudt. Tel daarbij nog je collega special ones( en BFF’s).
Land in je data droomjob. Is er leven na het traineeship? Absoluut! Als een future proof data expert. Wie weet word jij ooit wel chief data officer…
Geniet! Hier maak je meteen deel uit van een hechte groep. Special ones. Met wie je banden smeedt voor het leven. Op events, workshops of tijdens het lopen.







Hoe word je een data chief?

Ontdek in jouw trainings hoe data skills (advanced analytics, functional analysis, visualization,…) en people skills (communicatie, self-leadership, …) een killer combo vormen in jouw dagelijkse werk.
Werk in data analytics, data management, data processing, business analytics, project management, data science, …
En groei dan nóg meer met personal coaching en data mentoring.







Klaar om te solliciteren?

Vul dan het sollicitatieformulier in. Heb je nog vragen? Stuur onze recruiter een mailtje: recruitment@ormittalent.be

Title: Onderzoeker en data-analist
Description:
De studiedienst volgt de evolutie van de gezondheidstoestand van de bevolking op en analyseert het socialezekerheidsstelsel. Binnen CM draagt ze bij aan de ontwikkeling van een langetermijnvisie op het gebied van gezondheid en (maatschappelijk) welzijn. De Studiedienst is verantwoordelijk voor het analyseren van de evoluties in de gezondheidszorg door middel van verkennende studies en ad-hoc analyses.




Dit zoeken we




Jouw opdrachten als onderzoeker en data-analist :

Je volgt thema’s op gerelateerd aan de economische aspecten van de gezondheidszorg en kan de vragen van de organisatie hierover beantwoorden.
Je bent in staat om gegevensextracties te doen en kwantitatief onderzoek uit te voeren op basis van deze gegevens.
Je voert budgettaire en economische gezondheidsgerelateerde analyses uit.
Je draagt bij aan de kennisopbouw van CM op het gebied van gezondheid.
Je werkt mee aan de onderzoeksprojecten van CM, in functie van de noden.
Je analyseert je onderzoeksresultaten kritisch en synthetiseert ze in een wetenschappelijk rapport. Je formuleert ook concrete aanbevelingen voor de directie.
Je deelt de resultaten van de studies op overtuigende wijze mee aan de verschillende doelgroepen (beleidsmakers, zorgverleners, burgers, enz.).
Je werkt je kennis en vaardigheden bij en werkt mee aan de ontwikkeling van de onderzoeksprocessen van CM.




Dit ben jij




Je hebt minimum een masterdiploma. Ervaring op het gebied van economie, volksgezondheid, gezondheidsbeleid, sociologie of statistiek is een troef.
Je beschikt over relevante werkervaring inzake kwantitatief onderzoek.
Je beschikt over relevante werkervaring inzake economische of budgettaire analyses, bij voorkeur in het domein van gezondheid.
Een kennis van de wetgeving op het vlak van gegevensbeheer is een troef.
Je bent in staat om gegevens te analyseren: kennis van SAS of python is een troef.
Je bent bereid om je kennis over de invaliditeits- en ziektekostenverzekering en over de verschillende aspecten van het gezondheidsbeleid te verdiepen.
Je bent een dynamische collega die ideeën aanbrengt en zich inzet voor de projecten van de dienst. Je hecht veel belang aan de resultaten van teamwerk.
Je bent ervan overtuigd dat solidariteit en universele toegang tot zorg belangrijke waarden zijn van het gezondheidsstelsel van ons land.
Je bent in staat om zelfstandig te werken en initiatief te nemen.
Je kan analytisch en kritisch denken.
Je hebt een uitstekende kennis van het Nederlands of het Frans, en je hebt een goed begrip van de andere taal.
Je hebt minimum een passieve kennis van het Engels.




Dit bieden we je




We bieden jou een voltijds contract van onbepaalde duur.

Je werkplaats bevindt zich in het hoofdkantoor van de Christelijke Mutualiteit (Haachtsesteenweg 579 – 1031 Schaarbeek).




Bij CM heeft je werk een belangrijke maatschappelijke impact. Je maakt immers dagelijks het verschil voor onze leden. Zo kan je rekenen op een competitief en veelzijdig loonpakket. Bovendien krijg je de kans om werk en privé mooi in evenwicht te houden. Maar er is meer. Want wie dat wil, kan hier heel wat kansen grijpen. We bieden je tal van opleidingen en ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden. Je krijgt de ruimte om initiatief te nemen. En je werkt mee aan uitdagende projecten. Wees er maar zeker van dat je nooit ter plaatse zult blijven trappelen. Zoals elke CM-collega zal je al snel tot de conclusie komen: Bij ons leeft het!

Show more

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
We're working with a forward-thinking SaaS company revolutionizing the real estate industry in Brussels. They've got a passionate team that is driving a successful product in the real estate market.




They're seeking a talented and experienced Senior Software Engineer to join their development team. You will have a strong background in building scalable applications using Angular and Node.js. You will play a crucial role in designing and implementing features that improve their platform's functionality and user experience.




Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain scalable web applications using Angular and Node.js.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define new features.
Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability.
Provide mentorship to junior developers.
Troubleshoot and debug applications to ensure optimal performance.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience.
5+ years of professional experience in software development, with a focus on Angular and Node.js.
Strong understanding of front-end technologies.
Experience with RESTful APIs and microservices architecture.
Familiarity with cloud services and DevOps practices.




Offer:

Up to €7,000 for particularly experienced applicants.
The chance to join a successful scale-up with the capacity to grow further.
Full benefits package including a company car.
Chance to develop your skills further and mentor junior developers.
Flexible hybrid work, with a new office in the heart of Brussels.
Inclusive team dynamic with regular team-building events.




If you are passionate about technology and eager to work in a vibrant and innovative environment, apply today!

Title: Test Engineer
Description:
We're looking for Test Engineer for a range of applications in Asset Management and Market & Adequacy (CRM) domains.




Service Overview:

The role involves several key tasks:

Test Plan and Scenario Development: Create detailed test plans and scenarios based on existing documentation and application functionalities. These plans will support testing in functional, non-functional (e.g., performance, volume), integration, and non-regression areas. Tests will be recommended based on the acceptance criteria defined in user stories.
Test Types:
Functional Testing
Non-functional Testing (e.g., performance and load testing)
Integration Testing
Non-regression Testing
Documentation Requirements: All testing documents must be in clear, simple English, accessible to a wide range of users across Europe.




Responsibilities:

Test Data Preparation: In some scenarios, the tester will need to generate specific test data before running tests.
Execution of Test Scenarios: Test execution is a key part of the mission, requiring efficient work and alignment with the team’s schedule. Bugs must be identified and tracked prior to deployment.
Test Automation: Collaborate with the team to identify key test cases for automation and implement automated testing processes.
Defect Management: Use bug-tracking tools to log and manage defects. Ensure all test documents are updated based on test results. Working closely with developers and the project lead, the goal is to achieve high-quality results. The tester will be responsible for approving the move from the test environment to the acceptance environment.
Follow-up and Communication: Any bugs identified in the acceptance or production environments must be addressed and recreated in the test environment. The IT Application Manager (ITAM) will manage the tester's tasks and assignments.




Task Breakdown:

30%: Test specification creation
30%: Test automation implementation
30%: Test execution and defect follow-up
10%: Test reporting




Requirements:

Demonstrated experience in writing test plans and scenarios.
Proficiency in test automation, with experience in RobotFramework as a significant advantage.
Experience working within an Agile/Scrum framework.
Strong English language skills (documentation and communication are primarily in English), with knowledge of French or Dutch being beneficial.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
Analytical mindset, able to challenge and critically assess situations.
Understanding of basic technical IT concepts such as client-server applications, web services, protocols, and both frontend and backend development.
Basic knowledge of databases and SQL queries.
Experience with MQTT, DevOps tickets, Windows applications, web applications, and tools like Grafana and Prometheus is an added advantage.
Soft skills: creativity, autonomy, critical thinking, and a results-driven, pragmatic approach.




Interested?

Please send me your cv to anne@bimona.be

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Description:
Job description

YOU DESIGN AND BUILD INNOVATIVE SOLUTIONS THAT GIVE OUR CLIENTS A HEAD START IN OUR NEW DIGITAL WORLD.

Capgemini

Capgemini is a rapidly growing international software consultancy company that strives to provide first-rate engineers with both excellent technical abilities and soft skills.

At Capgemini, we believe that people can improve the world through the power of technology. We do this by creating a nurturing environment that promotes growth and creative thinking.

We enable our engineers and customers with innovative solutions to address some of the most challenging problems out there.

We deliver added value to our customers by building reusable accelerators, developing innovative blueprints, and supporting their technology strategy.

What will you be doing?

You have a passion for innovation and know-how to use your engineering skills to our clients a solid lead in the digital world. You will lead multidisciplinary teams on innovative solutions.
You advise our clients on technology during a sprint zero and deliver the solution with your Capgemini engineering team.
You own one a value stream within Capgemini, enabling our engineers and our overall company growth.
You lead, mentor and inspire a group of highly experienced engineers. You lead by example by taking ownership, being proactive and collaborating.
You will be part of a culture with a high bar of engineering and emotional intelligence standards where development paths are self-determined within a mentor-led environment to support and guide these growth opportunities.

Job requirements

How do you qualify?

Well, we ask you to come prepared and would like to hear your story and see what you have in your “rucksack” already. Tell us about:

Your way of leading and supporting people and the successes and challenges you had.
Your experience coaching and enabling delivery across engineering teams.
Your most recent and outstanding project developed, preferably in Java, .NET, or similar technologies.
Your knowledge on design patterns and software development best practices.
Your experience with Domain-Driven Design, Microservices and what you have learned working with them,
Your story working with Event-Driven architectures and patterns.
Your experience working with Azure.
Your view on the pros and cons of working in an Agile environment.
Your story on what is the advantage of Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, and your vision on how to apply testing.
A situation that shows your strong communication skills and ability to present ideas.

Our offer

Of course, you will get a competitive salary with other interesting benefits. But more importantly, you will work at a fantastic and pleasant place where you can do more than just engineering. You will be learning, developing yourself, organizing events and speaking at conferences.

Are you ready and do you think you are the next Software Engineer we are looking for? Do not hesitate to apply.

(By applying to this vacancy, you agree with a background check if applicable.)

At Capgemini, we believe that people can improve the world through the power of technology. We do this by creating a nurturing environment that promotes growth and creative thinking.

We enable our engineers and customers with innovative solutions to address some of the most challenging problems out there.

We deliver added value to our customers by building reusable accelerators, developing innovative blueprints, and supporting their technology strategy.

What will you be doing?

  • You have a passion for innovation and know-how to use your engineering skills to our clients a solid lead in the digital world. You will lead multidisciplinary teams on innovative solutions.
  • You advise our clients on technology during a sprint zero and deliver the solution with your Capgemini engineering team.
  • You own one a value stream within Capgemini, enabling our engineers and our overall company growth.
  • You lead, mentor and inspire a group of highly experienced engineers. You lead by example by taking ownership, being proactive and collaborating.
  • You will be part of a culture with a high bar of engineering and emotional intelligence standards where development paths are self-determined within a mentor-led environment to support and guide these growth opportunities.

Job requirements

How do you qualify?

Well, we ask you to come prepared and would like to hear your story and see what you have in your “rucksack” already. Tell us about:

  • Your way of leading and supporting people and the successes and challenges you had.
  • Your experience coaching and enabling delivery across engineering teams.
  • Your most recent and outstanding project developed, preferably in Java, .NET, or similar technologies.
  • Your knowledge on design patterns and software development best practices.
  • Your experience with Domain-Driven Design, Microservices and what you have learned working with them,
  • Your story working with Event-Driven architectures and patterns.
  • Your experience working with Azure.
  • Your view on the pros and cons of working in an Agile environment.
  • Your story on what is the advantage of Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, and your vision on how to apply testing.
  • A situation that shows your strong communication skills and ability to present ideas.

Our offer

Of course, you will get a competitive salary with other interesting benefits. But more importantly, you will work at a fantastic and pleasant place where you can do more than just engineering. You will be learning, developing yourself, organizing events and speaking at conferences.

Are you ready and do you think you are the next Software Engineer we are looking for? Do not hesitate to apply.

(By applying to this vacancy, you agree with a background check if applicable.)

Title: Full Stack Developer
Description:
Company: POLITICO

POLITICO is seeking an experienced Full Stack Developer to join our pioneering and growing media company in Brussels. Political decision-making is distributed, disorganized, and generally hard to follow at a larger scale, this is the issue we work on at POLITICO. By collecting, normalizing, organizing and thoughtfully presenting information we give individuals and organizations greater insight into political processes around the world.

What You’ll Do

As a full stack developer at POLITICO, you’ll work on all aspects of our stack ranging from data collection systems, REST and GraphQL APIs, background jobs, serverless applications, frontend single page applications, and cloud infrastructure. You will be an important player in an agile development team dedicated to building the technology that delivers our POLITICO Pro platform to policy professionals.

Our team holds itself to the highest standard and employs techniques such as conventional commits, continuous integration, test-driven development, infrastructure as code, and agile development with two-week sprints. We expect you to align with our core values and be a driving force towards further improvements of code quality and excellence in delivering our applications to customers.

What You’ll Need


Proven experience in building and working with large multi-service applications.
Fluency in English; any other European language is an asset.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
Comfortable in an international environment.
Highly proficient in JavaScript, with a strong track record in web development, while demonstrating the ability to adapt to various programming languages as needed.
Experience with frontend frameworks like Vue or React.
Understand asynchronous concepts like message queues and service interoperability.
Having experience with cloud infrastructure (Amazon Web Services and infrastructure as code (e.g. Terraform) is a bonus).
Experience with Kubernetes is a bonus.
Experience with React Native and Ruby on Rails is a bonus.


We Value Our People

Our benefits package is built for you, and includes:


Hybrid work: Whether you love company and enjoy collaborating with colleagues in person or want some time alone at home to get some deep work done.
Work from abroad days: Fancy a workday from atop a mountain resort, or want to work from your parent’s dining room table around the holidays? POLITICO offers the opportunity to work from abroad for a limited period each year.
Health and Wellness: Across the different cities where we have offices, we offer various initiatives that contribute to your well-being.
Transportation: Say goodbye to traffic jams and hello to smooth commutes. POLITICO partially covers public transportation costs.
Personal and Professional Growth: From dedicated pieces of training to regular career chats, with our Grow@POLITICO program, we put your professional development and growth first.


About POLITICO

POLITICO is a global news and information company at the intersection of politics and policy. It is the essential online, mobile and print destination for the most influential people in the world. With publications based in Washington, D.C., New York, London, Paris, and Brussels, POLITICO boasts an enormous roster of the most talented reporters and editors in the world.

Equal Opportunity

It is POLITICO's policy to provide equal employment opportunity to all qualified individuals without regard to race, colour, religion, national origin, gender, age or any other characteristic protected by local laws and regulations.

Application Instructions & Further Details

If you are interested in this opportunity, please send a CV and motivation letter in English outlining why you’re right for this role.

Questions? Contact recruitment@politico.eu with the subject line: JOB TITLE. Please apply, however, via the online form.

Location: Brussels

Employment level: Full-time

Type of role: Specialist

Updated: Aug 8, 2024

Job ID: 00564

Title: Test engineer
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development. The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

Our experts thoroughly test our solutions to ensure we’re always on the safest path to positive outcomes and meet the high standards we set ourselves. As a testing expert, you’ll create and execute test plans, both manual and automated, using the latest test management tools. You’ll have an eye for bugs and imperfections, identifying and documenting defects and tracking bugs before they become problematic. We trust our testers to identify the safest, most efficient path to a solution while paying scrupulous attention to details and maintaining their expertise by staying up to date on the latest software development life cycles to ensure software quality and performance.

Qualifications

As a Test Engineer, you’ll ensure the smooth operation of our software across departments through testing and quality assurance.

You have the following knowledge and experience:


You’re a team player with excellent communication skills and a student of emerging industry trends.
You’ll spend your days designing and executing test plans, developing automated test scripts, and identifying software defects. Should software defects arise, you’re quick to identify and fix them.
You have analytic and problem-solving abilities
You are proficient with tools like Selenium, JIRA, and Agile
Bachelor or master degree in IT or relevant equivalent
Fluent in Dutch/French and English


Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!

Want to know what happens next?

The recruitment process typically begins with the first step, where the recruiter screens candidates based on their qualifications and fit for the role. This is followed by the second step, where candidates undergo more in-depth evaluations, including technical assessments and an interview with the capacity manager to assess both technical skills and team compatibility. The third step involves the company reviewing feedback and aligning on a potential offer. Finally, in the final step, the candidate receives a formal job offer.

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Release Train Engineer (Freelance)
Description:
Our client is looking for a Senior Release Train Engineer to join the PMR-Project within the Transport Executions domain. This is a long-term contract based in Brussels, Belgium, with a hybrid working model (3 days remote). The candidate must be based in Belgium and have proficiency in English, along with either Dutch or French.




Your role

Collaborate with the Program Manager to facilitate PI (Program Increment) planning and drive the DIOR program.
Identify and remove impediments to ensure team progress and successful project delivery.
Provide guidance in managing risks and dependencies across multiple teams.
Coach teams in Lean, Agile, and Scrum practices, ensuring continuous improvement.
Act as a leader for the Agile Release Train (ART) to ensure successful delivery.
Manage project scopes, timelines, and align initiatives with business goals.
Foster collaboration across cross-functional teams, including analysts, UX designers, and product managers, to deliver high-quality solutions.




Your profile

Master’s degree in a relevant field.
Strong technical background with experience in Cloud and Front-end development.
Excellent understanding of Agile principles and practices, ideally with experience in SAFE.
Leadership skills with proven experience working with cross-functional teams.
Ability to navigate conflict resolution and negotiate effectively.
Experience working with C-level executives and creating strategic roadmaps.
Proficiency in English (spoken and written), with French or Dutch as an additional language.
Familiarity with source control (e.g., Git) and applying unit testing.




Highly appreciated skills

Strong leadership and stakeholder management skills.
Ability to influence without authority, inspire teams, and drive organizational agility.
Skilled in conflict resolution, negotiation, and managing resource constraints.

Title: Full Stack developer Elixir / Ruby / ReactJS
Description:
Job Description

Location: Hybrid, EU timezone (CET +/- 2 hours)

Start Date: As soon as possible

Languages: English required

As a Full Stack Elixir / Ruby / ReactJS Developer, you will join one of our client's mission teams, consisting of several developers, a product manager, and a product designer.

These mission teams are focused on business and product objectives and may work on one or several products.

Depending on the team you join, your responsibilities will include:


Actively contributing to the implementation of the product and technical roadmap,
Developing various applications and services in Elixir (or Ruby) and React JS,
Participating in the technical design of features and the development of new services,
Promoting best practices and code quality through unit tests, documentation, etc.,
Representing the Tech team both internally and externally by participating in “employer branding” projects (writing articles, open source, meetups, etc.).



Profile Sought

Our client aims for a positive social impact with a strong emphasis on diversity, inclusion, and equity.

Regardless of your educational background, we are looking for a passionate individual who will seamlessly integrate into the team and take responsibility for these values.


You are already familiar with their stack or eager to learn it,
You are pragmatic and thorough, aware of the impact of your work,
You are versatile and adaptable, capable of managing various aspects of development while maintaining a holistic view to guide the team towards the most relevant solutions,
You practice clean code (test culture, conventions, best practices, etc.),
You are interested in performance and scalability issues,
Our client receives approximately 3 million unique visitors per month (and continues to grow!). Response times and uptime are crucial for ensuring a high-quality experience.
You consider security in your work,
You enjoy sharing your discoveries and best practices with the team to help everyone evolve,
You are proactive and like to challenge current or proposed solutions,
Regardless of tenure or experience, our client values initiative; everyone is free to propose ideas and will be heard,
You can explain technical topics to non-specialists,
You listen to others and share your opinions with kindness.

Description:
Au Quotidien, Des Tâches Diverses Et Variées


Prendre en charge la spécification et la conception des systèmes embarqués
Le développement et les tests du logiciel
Intervenir sur l'ensemble du cycle de développement



Profil Recherché

Passionné.e de technologies, alors embarque dans des projets de grande envergure tout en profitant d'un suivi personnalisé!!!


Titulaire d'un Master en ingénierie
Maitrise de Linux et du C
Familier avec la notion de temps réel
Intéressé par les nouvelles technologies de différents secteurs et environnements
De nature rigoureuse et minutieuse
Bon communicant avec un attrait pour le travail d'équipe



Rémunération : 37-45 k

A Propos

Engagé.e.s pour l'égalité des chances, nous pensons que la diversité est une richesse. Nous savons respecter, apprécier et valoriser les différences de chacun.e : ce sont vos qualités humaines qui seront considérées.

“Connect and Create for Change”... with us !

IT Link, expert des systèmes connectés

Chez IT Link, cela fait 35 ans que nous misons sur la connexion des technologies, des objets et des personnes pour apporter des réponses aux grands défis actuels de notre société (environnement, santé, sécurité…).

Nous accompagnons nos clients dans leurs projets d’innovation et de transformation, des technologies embarquées à l’application métier en passant par le cloud et la science des données.

Pour cela, nous comptons sur nos 750 Linkers présent.e.s sur 14 agences réparties dans le monde (France, Benelux, Canada et Maroc). A horizon 2025, l’objectif est d’atteindre 1000 collaborateurs.trices pour soutenir notre forte croissance.

Title: Java Developer
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development. The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

Java fluency means you can develop, test and maintain any application that’s written in Java. It means your Java code is clean and efficient and you can assist cross-departmental teams with your interpersonal fluency to deliver high-quality software solutions. You’ll use Java frameworks like Spring and Hibernate, and tools like Maven to navigate databases, version control systems (like Git), and innovative methodologies with agility. Your problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to adapt to evolving technologies and project requirements mean you’ll have no trouble debugging and resolving issues in your day-to-day work, or adapting to the requirements of the cutting edge projects Sopra Steria delivers. 

Our Developers specialise in application and software development while seamlessly integrating systems, so we never lose sight of our business goals. With an eye towards user experience and productivity, you’ll design, code, and test new functionalities while troubleshooting issues, optimizing performance, and keeping technical documentation in order. Our developers love to design and are always informed of the latest design trends. When fulfilling day-to-day tasks, you’ll always be ready with a solution when there’s a problem. You’ll also collaborate with other teams and never miss a detail so you can deliver solutions that meet Sopra Steria’s quality standards.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!


Java
The Spring Stack (Spring Boot, Spring MVC, Spring Data, Spring Cloud)
Testing (unit, integration, acceptance)
Cloud (AWS or Azure)
DevOps
Scrum
Kanban
Education: Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a relevant equivalent
Languages: English (required), French and/or Dutch desirable


What We Can Offer You

As a member of one of Europe’s largest digital solutions providers, you’ll benefit from extensive career development opportunities, both local and international. At the Sopra Steria Academy, you’ll be part of a dynamic network of 56,000 professionals at all stages of their careers. With a wide array of offices to explore, you can find your ideal location and take the next step in your career.

You’ll become a part of a major Tech player in Europe recognised for its consulting, digital services, and software development. On top of that, you’ll join a team that is called Design & Develop. Our team thrives on genuine connections, flexibility, and continuous learning through training, ensuring we deliver innovative solutions that help clients embrace digital transformation. Specializing in Application Lifecycle Management, Application Modernization, and Digital Experience Management, we apply AI, Cloud, and Security principles to craft tailored solutions across .NET, Java, and Digital platforms.

Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider. We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers. Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!

Want to know what happens next?

The recruitment process typically begins with the first step, where the recruiter screens candidates based on their qualifications and fit for the role. This is followed by the second step, where candidates undergo more in-depth evaluations, including technical assessments and an interview with the capacity manager to assess both technical skills and team compatibility. The third step involves the company reviewing feedback and aligning on a potential offer. Finally, in the final step, the candidate receives a formal job offer.

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: IT Innovation Software Engineer
Description:
IT Innovation Software Engineer




Your mission




The projects you will be working on are aimed at implementing new solutions that will contribute to the development of a catalogue of services supporting our customers in the digital transformation sector, and more specifically concerning their flows of administrative documents.




Your responsibilities




As IT Innovation Software Engineer, you will be responsible for developing technical solutions using a modern approach that promotes the values of simplicity and efficiency, while focusing on the security aspects of the solutions implemented.




As Innovation Software Engineer, your role will be to:




Understand In-depth customer and internal stakeholder requirements to design optimal and sustainable microservices architectures.
Participate in the design, development and deployment of microservices in collaboration with the technical teams.
Work closely with development teams to ensure seamless integration of microservices into existing environments.
Lead technical workshops with customers and internal teams to define and refine solution architectures.
Maintain and optimize existing microservices, guaranteeing optimum performance and security.
Actively participate in team meetings to contribute to the continuous improvement of development standards and processes.
Be responsible for the technical coaching of junior team members and use your experience to ensure that good development practices are in place.




Your profile




As IT Innovation Software Engineer, you have:




A degree in IT, engineering or equivalent by experience
Between 3 and 5 years of experience as a senior engineer (DevOps) or architect (Cloud)
Very good knowledge in the following technologies: nodejs, kubernetes, serverless, AWS, Azure, Terraforms, Ansible…
Excellent knowledge in French and English.




And you also are:

Innovative, passionate and curious for the NTIC.
customer-oriented and a driving force for knowledge sharing.
Analytic (Architecture) and you can bring a global view.




Our offer




A competitive salary package - Your salary comes with extra-legal benefits, such as a company car, profit sharing, group and hospitalization insurance and meal vouchers.
Lots of autonomy and flexibility for direct impact on the growth of speos.
A stimulating and evolving role with many challenges, opportunities and innovative projects.
A dynamic team in a family company culture!
A unique atmosphere, collegiality and conviviality.




You will join us in a diverse team of highly talented colleagues, where there is room for ideas, initiative and professional development.




Why speos ?




speos is an innovative, leading Belgian company that develops solutions designed to empower companies with optimized and secure administrative and financial processes. We manage all aspects of your outbound document workflow, from document generation to distribution across print and digital channels.

The ultimate goal of speos is to ensure the success of our customers' administrative and financial processes. This allows them to concentrate all their efforts on their core business.

speos' strategy and its position as a subsidiary of the bpost group since 2001 make us the #1 reference in our field of expertise in Belgium. We owe this recognition to our ambitious management, state-of-the-art technological know-how and proven customer service.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist, Energy Analytics
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


Master's degree in Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Operations Research, Engineering, a related quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of work experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL), querying databases or statistical analysis, or a PhD degree.


Preferred qualifications:


PhD in Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field.
5 years of work experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL), querying databases or statistical analysis, or a PhD degree.
Experience in working or internship as an energy analyst, trader, system operator, etc., including experience applying advanced analytics to energy systems’ planning, control and learning problems within universities, national labs, electric utility companies.
Experience with the energy system data.
Experience with optimization (e.g., cvx, Gurobi), statistical (e.g., R, Python) software, and database languages (e.g., SQL).


About The Job

At Google, data drives all of our decision-making. Data Scientists work all across the organization to help shape Google's business and technical strategies by processing, analyzing, interpreting huge data sets, as well as coming up with new algorithmic and statistical approaches that improve performance and efficiency of Google-wide systems.

As an energy analyst, you will collaborate with Google’s Climate Operations team, Energy and Policy Strategists, Engineers and Product Managers to adjust Google's energy systems and practices based on your findings. You will apply an understanding of energy systems and market dynamics, optimization and statistical knowledge, as well as the coding experience, to develop methods to solve and assess the cutting edge problems related to carbon and efficiency aware compute shifting, grid integration, energy asset forecasting and scalable control. You will work broadly with different energy stakeholders across the organization and drive innovation of our energy systems stack, while improving its efficiency and global environmental impact.

As an Energy Analytics Data Scientist, you will think critically and strategically about Google’s fleet-wide energy assets, cloud as a technology, business and its operation, while thinking about its impact on the environment as a whole.

Responsibilities


Lead projects with energy system, market analysis and carbon impact analysis, modeling and optimization, drawing from multiple problem solving methods and energy domain expertise to choose the right tool and right level of complexity appropriate for the business challenges.
Engage broadly with the organization to identify, prioritize, frame, and structure complex and ambiguous challenges arising in the energy domain, where advanced analytics projects or tools can have the high impact.
Identify and communicate the challenges and opportunities that the group should be working on.
Articulate business questions and use mathematical techniques to arrive at an answer using data. Translate analysis results into business recommendations.
Help define the problem solving direction and influence the direction of the associated engineering and infrastructure work.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
Show more

Title: Machine Learning / Deep Learning – Python Coding Wizard ( 70% - 100% )
Description:
With joy and pioneering spirit, we at Imnoo strive to use the opportunities of automation! Become a part of our team and bring in your talents and know-how: together we shape the future of our customers.

We are looking for a Machine Learning – Python/Cloud Services Wizard who is capable to help us develop and roll out new/existing services.

Clear path for career advancement within the company

Your Playground


Development of efficient feature extraction and data-processing pipelines for managing CAD, 2D and unfiltered/filtered batch of data for Machine Learning
Design/Engineer/Take responsibility for cloud services, APIs, automated model training/deployment, build tools
Take end-to-end responsibility for services: from POC to production ready.
Get in-depth knowledge of interconnected Cloud/Data/Computer Vision/ML services across multiple languages and platforms
Further development and maintenance of Optimization/Machine Learning services
Further development and maintenance of 2D/3D/CAD data analysis
Lead the development of 2D drawing/computer vision problem


Our Offer


Fully flexible work-style
Snacks of your choosing
Opportunities for professional development and certification support
Learn/Use a broad stack of machine learning/data analysis tools
Your ideas and opinion are expected and highly appreciated
Developing your hard and soft skills within a diverse team on the job
Working in a dynamic start-up environment with a dedicated young team
25 days vacation
Open amount of home office / offsite work
Great work-life balance with regular social team events


Nice to have:


Expertise in full-stack data science tools including data wrangling/munging, iterative and batch analysis
Mathematician/statistician educations with strong dedication and experience in applied technologies
Experience in creation of your own business/apps/ventures
Experience in Frontend (Angular) / Backend development
Full-Stack experience
Experience with well-known ML/DL libraries: sklearn, PyTorch, Lightning
Experience with models industrialization tools: quantization, ONNX, Docker, ...
Experience with MLOps practices and Pipeline development
Efficient processing, clustering, filtering, indexing, querying of large datasets
Automated model training and deployment
Strategic data analysis and research: statistical tests, propagation of error, Identifying clusters and outliers
Experience in Cloud:
AWS
Azure Cloud Services
SQL / NoSQL Skills
Data Structures understanding
C#, C++ any other compiled languages

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Hey there, future innovator! At Creaitor we’re reshaping the way companies manage their content marketing. Since 2022 we’ve been building the leading AI-driven platform to help businesses streamline their entire content marketing lifecycle. We’re at home in beautiful Lucerne, Switzerland but our growing team mostly works remotly to build amazing AI solutions for customers all over the world.

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Lead Machine Learning Engineer to spearhead our machine learning initiatives working directly with Creaitor's CTO. This role is critical as you will lay the foundation for our ML/AI capabilities and lead the development of innovative solutions that enhance our platform. You will cover both the roles of a Machine Learning Engineer and a Data Scientist, working closely with product managers to build and deploy cutting-edge models that meet the needs of our customers.

Tasks


Lead ML Development: Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models.
Strategy and Vision: Develop and execute a strategic roadmap for machine learning initiatives aligned with Creaitor’s goals.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for leveraging machine learning to solve complex problems and improve user experience.
Vector Database Management: Set up and manage vector databases to efficiently store and retrieve high-dimensional data, enabling fast and accurate similarity searches.
Data Management: Collect, preprocess, and analyze large datasets to inform model development and extract actionable insights.
Feature Engineering: Perform feature engineering to enhance model performance and accuracy.
Model Training: Train and fine-tune machine learning models using state-of-the-art techniques.
Model Optimization: Evaluate and optimize model performance to ensure accuracy, efficiency, and scalability.
Research and Innovation: Stay up-to-date with the latest research and advancements in machine learning and AI to continuously enhance our platform.
Testing and Maintenance: Implement and maintain robust testing frameworks to ensure the reliability of machine learning solutions.
Documentation: Document processes, models, and methodologies to ensure knowledge sharing and reproducibility.


Requirements


Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Experience: Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or similar role, with a strong portfolio of successful projects.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or similar. Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, etc.
Foundational Knowledge: Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software engineering principles.
LLM Expertise: Experience in developing AI/ML solutions with a focus on LLM and LLM frameworks (e.g. LangChain). Strong knowledge and practical experience in Generative AI
NLP Expertise: Knowledge of natural language processing (NLP) techniques and tools.
Vector Databases: Experience in working with vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, FAISS, Milvus) to store and manage high-dimensional data for similarity searches and recommendation engines.
Cloud Experience: Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) is a plus.
Leadership: Demonstrated ability to lead projects and work independently as well as part of a team.
Communication Skills: Strong communication skills and the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


Benefits


Work remotely while being an indispensable member of our global team. You’ll have all the tools at your disposal to fascilitae communication and a great work environment.
Work at the heart of a growing AI startup with a unique culture and ambitions to match your own.
We are result driven and give you the space and flexibility to organize your work as it best suits you.
Get the opportunity to be a co-owner of a successfull startup with Creaitor’s Employee Stock Options Program.
Be part of the initial scaling team and shape the future of Creaitor with us


We’re fresh off of closing our pre-seed financing round and are ready to kick our growth into high gear by welcoming new team members with exceptional talent to grow Creaitor to the preferred AI Content Marketing platform for businesses worldwide. If this sounds exciting to you, apply now!
Show more
