  • Strategy and Vision: Develop and execute a strategic roadmap for machine learning initiatives aligned with Creaitor’s goals.
  • Cross-functional Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for leveraging machine learning to solve complex problems and improve user experience.
  • Vector Database Management: Set up and manage vector databases to efficiently store and retrieve high-dimensional data, enabling fast and accurate similarity searches.
  • Data Management: Collect, preprocess, and analyze large datasets to inform model development and extract actionable insights.
  • Feature Engineering: Perform feature engineering to enhance model performance and accuracy.
  • Model Training: Train and fine-tune machine learning models using state-of-the-art techniques.
  • Model Optimization: Evaluate and optimize model performance to ensure accuracy, efficiency, and scalability.
  • Research and Innovation: Stay up-to-date with the latest research and advancements in machine learning and AI to continuously enhance our platform.
  • Testing and Maintenance: Implement and maintain robust testing frameworks to ensure the reliability of machine learning solutions.
  • Documentation: Document processes, models, and methodologies to ensure knowledge sharing and reproducibility.

Requirements

  • Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
  • Experience: Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or similar role, with a strong portfolio of successful projects.
  • Technical Skills: Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or similar. Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, etc.
  • Foundational Knowledge: Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software engineering principles.
  • LLM Expertise: Experience in developing AI/ML solutions with a focus on LLM and LLM frameworks (e.g. LangChain). Strong knowledge and practical experience in Generative AI
  • NLP Expertise: Knowledge of natural language processing (NLP) techniques and tools.
  • Vector Databases: Experience in working with vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, FAISS, Milvus) to store and manage high-dimensional data for similarity searches and recommendation engines.
  • Cloud Experience: Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) is a plus.
  • Leadership: Demonstrated ability to lead projects and work independently as well as part of a team.
  • Communication Skills: Strong communication skills and the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Benefits

  • Work remotely while being an indispensable member of our global team. You’ll have all the tools at your disposal to fascilitae communication and a great work environment.
  • Work at the heart of a growing AI startup with a unique culture and ambitions to match your own.
  • We are result driven and give you the space and flexibility to organize your work as it best suits you.
  • Get the opportunity to be a co-owner of a successfull startup with Creaitor’s Employee Stock Options Program.
  • Be part of the initial scaling team and shape the future of Creaitor with us

We’re fresh off of closing our pre-seed financing round and are ready to kick our growth into high gear by welcoming new team members with exceptional talent to grow Creaitor to the preferred AI Content Marketing platform for businesses worldwide. If this sounds exciting to you, apply now!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Would like to be part of something bigger, where your career will make a real and positive contribution to the world?




At the medimaps group, our core mission to improve patient lives is at the heart of everything we do. Driven by this mission, our world class R&D team have developed cutting edge AI powered medical imaging software that assesses bone health and improves fracture risk detection. For the millions of patients worldwide suffering from osteoporosis, medimaps software provides a simple and effective win-win solution for patients and clinicians battling to predict and treat bone health problems.




If its time for you to choose a career you can be proud of, medimaps can provide a real and meaningful opportunity for you to change the world of patient care one scan at a time ...




Meaningful Mission: As a Clinical Artificial Intelligence (AI) Data Scientist, you will be pivotal in leading the design, development, and deployment of cutting-edge algorithms for medical image processing. Leveraging your expertise in machine learning and image analysis, you will enhance our solutions by extracting meaningful features from multimodal data sources, transforming raw inputs into actionable insights. You will drive the development of advanced prediction systems, integrating clinical expert knowledge with machine learning techniques, with a special emphasis on radiology and medical imaging applications for bone and musculoskeletal health.




CLINICAL AI DATA SCIENTIST

Location: Based in Geneva with Hybrid options available

Start Date: Ideally 1st Jan 2025

Contract: Full time at 100%




So lets look at the Challenge in more detail :

You will be responsible for achieving a broad range of objectives, including :

Design and develop advanced neural networks and AI-driven solutions for processing medical images from various imaging modalities, including X-ray and CT.
Lead research in state-of-the-art image processing techniques, including medical image texture and feature analysis, applying the latest methodologies in the field.
Explore and implement modular and hybrid machine learning approaches, incorporating multiscale, multifactor, and covariate modelling for robust and accurate predictions.
Develop and apply large language models (LLMs) to extract, interpret, and process clinical information, integrating unstructured data with structured medical insights.
Design and deploy solutions for on-premises and cloud environments, ensuring scalability and security for healthcare applications.
Create and maintain R&D tools for use in technical and clinical studies, enabling seamless development and validation of innovative AI solutions.
Program in RStudio/R and Python for statistical analysis and graphical computing, leveraging advanced analytics for data-driven decisions.
Ensure thorough documentation of research activities, adhering to best practices in reproducibility and transparency for future reference and regulatory purposes.
Contribute to scientific publications, sharing findings in peer-reviewed journals and presenting at relevant conferences.
Commitment to quality and regulatory compliance in all aspects of your work




What do you need to succeed?

The candidate we seek is a forward thinking, innovative and highly collaborative researcher with the following range of skills:




Technical capabilities:

Master’s degree (MS) in Computer Science, Mathematics, Biomedical Sciences, or a related field. A Ph.D. in these areas is strongly preferred.
Minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience developing Artificial Neural Networks (ANN), Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), and/or Machine Learning (ML) / Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions.
Demonstrated experience in the design and development of ANN, CNN, Deep Learning (DL), and Machine Learning (ML) models, with a focus on real-world applications.
Proven expertise in image processing, ideally with experience in medical imaging modalities such as X-ray and CT.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, C#, and/or C++ for AI and image processing applications.
Experience in developing and deploying solutions in cloud computing environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP), as well as on-premises implementations.
Strong statistical analysis skills, particularly in the medical or healthcare domain, with experience in using statistical tools and methodologies relevant to medical data.
Experience in developing R&D tools and custom solutions for research purposes, with proficiency in coding for technical and clinical studies.
Research experience or familiarity with bone health, dental health, or related biomedical fields is highly desirable.
Solid understanding of clinical workflows, medical imaging technologies, and quantitative imaging techniques.
Ability to document and present research findings effectively, contributing to scientific publications and conference presentations.
Fluency in written and verbal English is essential, with the ability to communicate complex technical information clearly and effectively.




Soft Skills:

To align with medimaps core values you will need to be:

Detail-oriented and results-driven, with a commitment to producing high-quality work.
Dynamic, creative, and open-minded, with a positive attitude and a willingness to explore innovative solutions.
Strong sense of team spirit, demonstrating excellent collaboration skills, adaptability, and flexibility in a fast-paced environment.
Organized and self-motivated, with the ability to plan and manage tasks independently while ensuring timely delivery.
Strong ethical values and exceptional communication skills, with a proactive approach to reporting and sharing information.
Demonstrates dedication, reliability, and persistence, with the ability to adapt to evolving challenges and drive continuous improvement.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Innovative mindset and a positive approach to challenges
Solutions and results oriented, with a strong bias for action
A Flexible and agile mindset is essential for working in our highly dynamic, innovative and fast growing organization
Ethical, honest and respectful in all personal and professional interactions – essential and non-negotiable!




NOTE: This position is open to all EU or Swiss citizens.




What you can expect of us?

As we work to develop patient centric solutions, we also work hard to care of our teammates’ professional development, personal growth and well-being. As an key member of our Research Team, you will be given every opportunity to make your mark with the freedom and creative license to innovate and develop new products.
The security of working in an innovative and successful company with a sustainable business model
The opportunity to work on cross functional projects across teams and country-borders
Working with an international, multi-cultural and socially responsible company with meaningful corporate values and an inspiring mission
Working with a genuinely great bunch of talented, professional and friendly people, who work hard but know how to have fun and make work a real pleasure
An exciting company mission that brings together science and technology to directly impact the lives of patients




In addition to this, medimaps offers a competitive compensation and benefits plan that is respectful of work life balance and which encourages eco-friendly awareness. This includes:

Competitive fixed salary
Excellent Pension and Insurance Schemes
Flexible work arrangements
Eco-allowance for using green means of transport
Subsidized parking, if public transport not an option
Swibeco lunch card




Apply now for a meaningful career that will really make a difference to you and the people around you. We are looking forward to receiving your application and to getting to know you better!




Please note that the hiring process may take several weeks, and we really appreciate your patience. We value your application and promise to get back to you as soon as we possibly can.

Thanks!




How to Apply

A CV is required and a cover letter puts you ahead of the pack (include cover letter in the same pdf as your CV please).




Candidates whose profiles do not meet our needs at this time will be notified at the end of the recruitment process. We anticipate that this may take approximately 6-8 weeks. We apologize in advance for this potential delay but will do our best to get back to you at the earliest possible opportunity.




Recruitment Agencies please do not reply. We will be managing this hire internally. Thanks for your understanding.

Title: Data Science Internship
Description:
If you are working towards a degree in information technology or a closely related field at EPFL or ETH, if you are a self-motivated and collaborative person with hands-on experience in machine learning or predictive analytics, this is the right place for you!




Logmind can offer you a variety of interesting technical challenges in the field of data science and machine learning. You will be working on solving problems that will help IT teams from modern organizations with the automatic detection and diagnosis of complex problems from their IT systems.




Your responsibilities will be:

Optimize, prototype, design and develop AI/ML algorithms for unstructured and time-series data.
Implement and test proposed algorithms for large-scale environments.
Closely collaborate with the software engineering team to integrate proposed models into the existing platform.




Required skills:

Experience in modern analytics tools and programming languages such as Python, Spark, Kafka, Scala, etc.
Knowledge of data mining algorithms and statistical modeling techniques such as clustering, classification, regression, decision trees, neural nets, support vector machines, anomaly detection, sequential pattern discovery, and text mining.
Relevant IT industry experience or interest would be a plus.




We look forward to receiving your resume at jobs[at]logmind.com!

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Our mission at LatticeFlow AI is to enable companies to deliver robust and trustworthy AI systems, especially in mission-critical domains. To solve this challenge, we are building the world's first platform for AI/ML teams to automatically find, assess, and fix data and model issues across the AI lifecycle.

As we push the boundaries of technology, we are now extending our core machine learning team with a Mid or Senior ML Engineer dedicated to work on LLMs.

Come and build the next generation of AI.

Your role at LatticeFlow AI

As a Machine Learning Engineer focusing on LLMs, your main responsibilities will be to:


Understand and work with the state-of-the-art LLM and SLM models
Follow the latest research (e.g., ACL, ICML, etc.) on topics related to reliability, safety and evaluation
Maintain and extend our open source tool evaluate LLM models on EU AI Act
Work together with the product team to scope and deliver new product features



Requirements

What you'll bring to our team?


Solid theoretical and practical background in machine learning and computer science
Experience in training/fine-tuning language models
Ability to write clean and maintainable code
Ability to read and understand the latest research and excitement to implement it and try it out


The following experience is considered a plus:


Experience in presenting technical content to technical and non-technical audiences
Experience with industry applications of LLMs


Soft Skills and Competencies:


Strong motivation, drive, and a desire to work in an energetic and fast-paced environment



Benefits

What's in it for you?


Pursue an intellectually challenging job with a real impact
Gain in-depth knowledge and experience in how world-leading organizations solve real-world problems with AI
Work at one of the world's hottest, fast-growing, deep tech AI start-ups - we are the #1 Swiss AI company for 2022 and among the youngest companies named on the prestigious CB Insights AI100
Work with domain experts and leaders in their field. We are a spin-off from ETH Zurich, one of the world's top 10 universities and our leadership has vast experience funding successful startups and/or working at leading AI companies
Participate in regular company events to bring together employees as one team across Europe & US
25 days of paid vacation
Equity plan



Did we catch your attention?

If this role and our mission resonate with you, but you're hesitant because you don't check all the boxes, don't let that hold you back. Apply for the role below, we'd love to meet you and discuss and share more!

LatticeFlow AI is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Eligibility to work in either Bulgaria or Switzerland is required. Please submit your application in English.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (OSS) in a fast-growing AI Startup
Description:
At the ETH spin-off Lightly, we build software solutions to help companies improve their deep learning models. The available data for deep learning grows faster than human tagging and available compute power. Our customers already face this problem and have too much data to process. As a solution, we built software to identify and work with the most relevant samples only. Learn more about us on our website.

We are a team of talented developers and researchers in Zurich, Prague and San Francisco and are backed by YCombinator. Every member of the team is going to have a massive impact.

Thus, we are looking for an experienced engineer with lots of passion for the subject. We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.

We Use a Modern Stack Of


PyTorch, Python, Typescript, C++, Rust, React, NodeJS
Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS


Tasks

As a Machine Learning Engineer in the core ML team, you will be part of a team which works mainly on our open-source package for self-supervised learning and similar internal frameworks.

Particularly, You Will Get To


Work on our open-source Python package for self-supervised learning: https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.
Add support for finetuning pretrained models for downstream tasks including many different computer vision tasks like object detection, segmentation, tracking, and more.
Keep up with current research in self-supervised learning and multi-modal models.
All these tasks will include working with state-of-the-art technology such as self-supervised learning, model distillation, vision language models and deep learning for computer vision in general.
Participate in and hold paper sessions about the latest papers in the field.
Represent the company at machine learning conferences and engage with the community.


In general, for this role expect to use the stack we use for our open-source package https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.

Requirements

Ideally, you have:


MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Experience in deep learning and computer vision, ideally in self-supervised learning and you have worked with PyTorch.
Excellent Python coding skills and knowledge of software engineering best practices. Experience with testing and typed Python is a big plus.
Experience with building and shipping software solutions.
Strong passion for new technologies and interest in keeping up with the latest technologies and publications in deep learning.


Benefits

We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.

Interested? Contact us!

We look forward to getting to know you!

Description:

Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS


Tasks

As a Machine Learning Engineer you will contribute to train and optimise state-of-the-art computer vision models to run on various hardware for real-time applications.

Particularly, You Will Get To


Design, train, and improve machine learning models for embedded devices, considering platform limitations.
Develop frameworks to evaluate and iterate on machine learning models.
Keep up with current research in self-supervised learning and multi-modal models.
Contribute to our product codebase written in Rust, C++, and Python.
Work with state-of-the-art technology such as self-supervised learning, model distillation, vision-language models, and deep learning for computer vision.
Participate in and hold paper sessions about the latest papers in the field.


Requirements

Ideally, you have:


MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
At least 2 years of industry experience in deep learning and computer vision, with experience in PyTorch.
Proficiency in Python.
Willingness to learn Rust and C++. Willingness to learn software engineering best practices to contribute to our product codebase. Previous experience is a plus.
Strong passion for new technologies and interest in keeping up with the latest technologies and publications in deep learning.
A creative, collaborative, and product-focused mindset.


Benefits

We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.

Interested? Contact us!

We look forward to getting to know you!

The available data for deep learning grows faster than human tagging and available compute power. Our customers already face this problem and have too much data to process. As a solution, we built software to identify and work with the most relevant samples only. Learn more about us on our website.

We are a team of talented developers and researchers in Zurich, Prague and San Francisco and are backed by YCombinator. Every member of the team is going to have a massive impact.

Thus, we are looking for an experienced engineer with lots of passion for the subject. We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.

We Use a Modern Stack Of

  • PyTorch, Python, Typescript, C++, Rust, React, NodeJS
  • Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS

Tasks

As a Machine Learning Engineer you will contribute to train and optimise state-of-the-art computer vision models to run on various hardware for real-time applications.

Particularly, You Will Get To

  • Design, train, and improve machine learning models for embedded devices, considering platform limitations.
  • Develop frameworks to evaluate and iterate on machine learning models.
  • Keep up with current research in self-supervised learning and multi-modal models.
  • Contribute to our product codebase written in Rust, C++, and Python.
  • Work with state-of-the-art technology such as self-supervised learning, model distillation, vision-language models, and deep learning for computer vision.
  • Participate in and hold paper sessions about the latest papers in the field.

Requirements

Ideally, you have:

  • MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • At least 2 years of industry experience in deep learning and computer vision, with experience in PyTorch.
  • Proficiency in Python.
  • Willingness to learn Rust and C++. Willingness to learn software engineering best practices to contribute to our product codebase. Previous experience is a plus.
  • Strong passion for new technologies and interest in keeping up with the latest technologies and publications in deep learning.
  • A creative, collaborative, and product-focused mindset.

Benefits

We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.

Interested? Contact us!

We look forward to getting to know you!

Title: Data Scientist / Large Language Model (LLM) Specialist
Description:
We are in search of a talented researcher/machine learning specialist to join our team as a Data Scientist with a focus on Large Language Models (LLM). The ideal candidate will possess a high level of proficiency in data science and demonstrate a strong emphasis on leveraging large language models. This person should have a deep technical understanding of machine learning, complemented by solid programming skills. We expect you to be autonomous and able to learn. Be ready to regularly learn new things (methodologies, technologies, domains) and adapt to a fast-moving environment.







Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement cutting-edge machine learning algorithms and models, with a specific emphasis on large language models incl. agents, fine-tuning, new transformers-based architectures.
Stay updated and share advancement on the state of the art.
Participate in local academic partnerships, and ideally develop and drive them.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to (a) share expertise and advice, and (b) implement some of the advanced solutions developed to solve complex business challenges.
More generally, contribute to the innovation and advancement of machine learning capabilities within the organization.
While not mandatory, experience in insurance and/or financial services will be considered a valuable asset.







Qualifications:

A solid background as a researcher and/or data scientist, or a strong interest in technical excellence and machine learning innovation.
In-depth knowledge of machine learning, deep learning and data science is mandatory. In-depth knowledge of natural language processing and in particular large language models is highly appreciated.
Exposure to the LLM’s ecosystem and associated frameworks.
Proficiency of Python, Jupyter Notebook and popular neural network frameworks (Tensorflow and/or PyTorch), along with a good understanding of software engineering principles.
Experience in training Machine Learning models on large data sets.
Open to continuous improvement of Data Science skills: we are seeking individuals who thrive in a dynamic and evolving environment, where learning and embracing new challenges are essential. The ideal candidates should demonstrate a strong willingness to continuously expand their knowledge, adapt to new technologies, and take on diverse and evolving responsibilities.
Team player, fruitful interactions with the other team members and external stakeholders
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Languages: English (mandatory) and French (appreciated).

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Responsibilities

Building and maintaining the backbone of our AI infrastructure for 3D scene synthesis
Architecting and managing large-scale systems that support data ingestion, model training, inference
Optimizing large-scale distributed machine learning systems
Creating robust, scalable solutions that enable our cutting-edge AI research and development
Contributing to applications for VR/AR product development
Together with our team, work towards a top-tier, scientific publication




Minimum Qualifications

Extensive experiences (2+ years building and maintaining infrastructure to support large-scale model training, model inference and data processing
Expertise in areas such as data infrastructure scaling, distributed model training, model optimization for efficient inference, or development of low-level ML kernels
Experience with performance engineering
Knowledge of database management and optimization
Deep domain knowledge in one or more AI/ML specialties
2+ years experience with AI/ML frameworks and tools (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Collaborative Spirit: We're building something bigger than any one person. We need team players who have excellent communication skills and thrive in a collaborative environment.
Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment.




Preferred Qualifications

Proven track record of working in teams to train or deploy large models, either at major tech companies or innovative startups
Experience with generative models (e.g. diffusion models, GANs), 3D representations (NeRFs, 3D Gaussian Splatting), and inverse rendering techniques
Demonstrated software engineer experience via previous internships, work experiences, coding competitions, or widely used contributions in open source repositories (e.g. GitHub).

Title: AI Engineer - Switzerland
Description:
This is a remote position.

Note: One of our clients is building a new team and hiring 8 AI Engineers globally. This is a 100% remote role. This role does not offer any visa sponsorship.

Job Summary:

As an AI Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing AI models and algorithms that solve complex business problems. You will work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and product teams to integrate AI solutions into our products. Your role will involve researching the latest AI technologies, building scalable machine learning models, and optimizing algorithms for performance and accuracy.

Key Responsibilities:


Design, develop, and deploy AI models and algorithms that address business needs and challenges.
Collaborate with data scientists and software engineers to collect, preprocess, and analyze large datasets.
Implement machine learning and deep learning models using frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras.
Optimize and tune models for performance, accuracy, and scalability.
Integrate AI solutions into production systems, ensuring seamless operation and reliability.
Research and stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI, machine learning, and data science.
Develop and maintain documentation for AI models, processes, and best practices.
Participate in code reviews and provide feedback to ensure high-quality code and adherence to best practices.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to AI models and systems in production environments.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure AI solutions align with business goals and objectives.


Qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in AI, machine learning, or a related field.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java.
Experience with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, or Scikit-learn.
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, neural networks, natural language processing (NLP), and computer vision.
Experience with data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation techniques.
Familiarity with cloud platforms and tools for AI and machine learning (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure).
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work with complex datasets.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Ability to manage multiple projects and deliver results on time.


Preferred Qualifications:


Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Kafka.
Knowledge of reinforcement learning, generative models, or advanced neural architectures.
Familiarity with DevOps practices for AI/ML, including CI/CD pipelines and containerization.
Relevant certifications in AI or machine learning.

Title: AI Inference Engineer (Edge) (100% Remote Switzerland)
Description:
At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.

The role involves building AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops.

Our dynamic team operates entirely remotely, uniting talent from every corner of the globe. Our journey has been marked by rapid growth and efficient operations, firmly establishing us as pioneers within the industry. Join us in building AI models and solutions that not only compete with but exceed the capabilities of current leaders, driving both technological advancement and broad accessibility.

What You'll Do:


Work on deploying machine learning models to edge devices using frameworks such as TVM, MLC, and IREE (MLIR).
Collaborate closely with researchers to assist in coding, training and transitioning models from research to production environments.
Integrate AI features into existing products, enriching them with the latest advancements in machine learning.
Excellent programming skills in Python, C and C++.
Experience with platforms such as TVM, MLC, and IREE (MLIR), which facilitate the deployment of models to specific GPU architectures.
Experience in NLP, computer vision, TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
Experience with different aspects of Large Language Models (LLMs), such as fine-tuning techniques to tailor models to specific tasks and prompt engineering.
Extensive experience in training models using multi-GPU setups.
Demonstrated ability to rapidly assimilate new technologies and techniques.
A degree in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, or a related field, complemented by a solid track record in AI R&D.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
📢 Notre mission? Ivy Partners est une société de conseil Suisse contribuant à l’évolution des entreprises dans leurs enjeux stratégiques, technologiques et organisationnels.




Notre objectif aujourd’hui est d’offrir à nos collaborateurs une carrière qui contribuera positivement à leur épanouissement et à leur bien-être, en les faisant monter en compétences et en leur offrant de réelles perspectives d’évolution.




👩‍💻🧑‍💻 En tant que AI Engineer chez Ivy Partners, vos missions seront:




Diriger la recherche et le développement de modèles d'IA multimodaux à la pointe de la technologie, repoussant les limites du possible et établissant de nouvelles références dans l'industrie.




Collaborer avec des équipes interfonctionnelles, y compris la data science, le développement produit et l'ingénierie, afin de garantir que les modèles d'IA soient intégrés de manière fluide dans des solutions axées sur le marché, améliorant ainsi l'engagement des clients et stimulant les résultats commerciaux.




Encourager l'innovation en se tenant informé des dernières avancées en matière d'IA, de traitement du langage naturel (NLP) et de modèles génératifs, en appliquant ces connaissances pour créer des solutions évolutives et percutantes.







🏅 À propos de vous !




Formation : Diplôme en informatique ou dans un domaine connexe. Un doctorat en IA, apprentissage automatique ou une discipline proche est fortement privilégié, accompagné d'un solide historique en recherche et développement dans le domaine de l'IA.




Développement de modèles d'IA : Expérience avérée dans la création de modèles à grande échelle tels que des Modèles de Langage de Grande Taille (LLM) depuis zéro. Cela inclut la rédaction de code efficace pour les modèles, la curation de larges ensembles de données pour l'entraînement, et l'optimisation des processus d'entraînement et d'inférence pour des applications IA haute performance.




Expertise technique : Maîtrise du Traitement du Langage Naturel (NLP), de l'apprentissage multimodal et des méthodologies avancées en IA. Expérience pratique confirmée avec des frameworks majeurs tels que TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX, et CUDA, essentiels pour l'optimisation des workflows d'apprentissage profond.




Compétences en programmation : Excellente maîtrise des langages de programmation comme Python, C++, JavaScript, ou similaires, vous permettant d'architecturer des systèmes d'IA complexes et de livrer des solutions évolutives.




Connaissance de l'industrie de l'IA : Familiarité avec les dernières tendances et meilleures pratiques en matière d'IA, y compris les modèles basés sur des architectures Transformer, les techniques d'optimisation de l'apprentissage profond et le déploiement de l'IA dans des environnements cloud, en particulier pour des applications à grande échelle dans le secteur du retail.







🤝 IVY, c’est aussi :

La bienveillance | Soucieux de nos employés, nous leur garantissons un environnement favorable où chacun est valorisé et se voit offrir des formations et des perspectives d’évolution en Suisse ou à l’international.




La confiance | Travailler avec nous, c’est développer un partenariat fondé sur la confiance, le professionnalisme et la transparence à chaque instant.




L’innovation | Nous garantissons une transformation numérique efficace grâce à l’innovation technologique couplée à la créativité.




La responsabilité | Le collectif est à la base de tout ce que nous entreprenons, et nous prenons cette responsabilité au sérieux en mettant tout en œuvre pour avoir un impact positif.

Title: (Senior) Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Michael Bailey Associates has partnered with a long-standing multinational manufacturing company that is looking to hire a Senior ML Engineer to join the AI team and work on cutting-edge GenAI projects that will boost sales, marketing and product development processes.




Responsibilities:




Leading the design, development, and implementation of advanced machine learning models, with a strong focus on generative AI to improve product design and customer solutions
Partnering with product development, engineering, and data science teams to embed AI-derived insights into multiple operational workflows
Developing and implementing scalable AI solutions for integration into product offerings and manufacturing systems
Mentoring junior engineers and data scientists
Enhancing machine learning pipelines for better scalability and performance, ensuring successful deployment in production environments
Contributing to the development of AI tools and frameworks that facilitate the digital transformation of business operations




Qualifications:




Strong command of Python, along with hands-on experience using cloud platforms and deploying machine learning models in real-world environments
Proven proficiency in data preparation, feature extraction, and assessing model performance
Knowledge of AI applications in CAD, BIM, or other design software commonly used in construction and manufacturing is advantageous
Background in MLOps and implementing AI models within industrial frameworks
Exceptional analytical capabilities combined with a cooperative approach to working in diverse team settings




Please apply with an updated resume.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (m/f/d, 100%)
Description:
About Liom:

Liom is a Swiss medtech venture with the vision to use state-of-the-art detection techniques to continuously monitor and learn from a wide range of vital medical indicators, allowing to improve your individual health.




What could you build on top of real-time and non-invasive Glucose monitoring? That is what Liom is all about, and we want to beat Apple at it.




Machine learning, personalized health, and predictive medicine. If these areas resonate with you, join us to work on foundational technologic and scientific challenges at Liom. We are a Swiss MedTech venture with the vision to use state-of-the-art detection techniques to continuously monitor and learn from a wide range of vital indicators, to better manage chronic diseases, to customize critical treatments and, to improve your health.




Your mission:

Using proprietary optical sensors, Liom is building a cutting-edge biomedical data generation pipeline to train medical-grade Machine Learning algorithms to infer glucose transcutaneously from spectral measurements. To achieve our vision, our team and advisory board consist of world experts coming from top academic institutions (ETH, EPFL, Columbia, Princeton, or Harvard among others) and industry leaders (Baxter, Roche, Lonza). We are looking for talented, experienced, voraciously curious, and self-driven professionals to join an A-team of doers: https://t.ly/vmCKi




After 4+ years in R&D phase, we are sprinting towards product development phase to launch to market. Therefore, joining as one of the first 60 permanent employees provides you great opportunities for growth in responsibilities and impact.




Responsibilities:

As a Sr. Machine Learning Engineer you will build ML Engineering infrastructure needed to deploy a portfolio of ML models and algorithms on our smartwatch and companion mobile Apps. To be effective in this role, you need to effectively interface with Science (ML Scientists, Data Scientists), Product Development (Electrical Engineering, Photonics, Manufacturing) and Product Management, to acquire and smartly embed multi-disciplinary knowledge into our ML Infrastructure.




You will be joining the Machine Learning Research & Engineering team, currently composed by 20 awesome colleagues. You will be working hand-in-hand with an A-team of 3 Software Engineering leaders, coming from the domains of Data, Cloud and App/Web development with a combined 40YOE in tech, plus an amazing and enthusiastic crew of junior engineers.




Your profile:

Master's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent ML experience.
8+ years of experience in writing software working with at least one compiled and one interpreted language such as Python, JavaScript, Java, Go, C, C++
6+ years of Machine Learning Experience in industry developing and deploying ML models in real-world applications.
Proficiency in software development methodologies, version control systems (e.g., Git), and CI/CD pipelines is essential.
In-depth understanding of MLOps principles and best practices, including model versioning, continuous integration and deployment of machine learning models, model monitoring, automated retraining, scalability and resource optimization. Experience with MLOps tools such as Kubeflow, MLflow.
Familiarity with containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes) and infrastructure-as-code tools (e.g., Terraform) is beneficial.
High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities, being comfortable in a dynamic and sometimes ambiguous environment.
The following qualifications are a plus:
Experience with distributed computing platforms (e.g., Spark) and cloud-based machine learning services (e.g., AWS SageMaker, Google Cloud Vertex AI )
Experience with Machine Learning at the Edge (optimization, HW accelerators, GPU, distributed computing)
Compliance and Governance: Understanding of compliance requirements and governance frameworks relevant to machine learning deployments, such as data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA) and medical device industry-specific standards would be a plus




IMPORTANT: we cannot sponsor working permits for non-EU / EFTA nationals for this role. Applications that do not fulfill this criteria will be automatically rejected.




We offer

Work/Life Balance

Working at a growing MedTech start-up is demanding and our goals are ambitious, which is why our team puts a strong emphasis on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. Therefore, we offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal life.




Values and Mission are important at Liom, as the ultimate goal is to improve people's well-being and we aspire to live that. We will have the chance to discuss value and mission during the interview process.




Diversity

With 18 nationalities in the company, we strive to build a diverse and exciting environment. Within the SMLE team we take special care of gender diversity - currently balanced at 50/50 among the permanent employees- and equal opportunities.




Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We want you to grow with Liom.




Amazing team!

In this role, you will be part of the Machine Learning Research & Engineering team, currently composed by 20 awesome colleagues from which you will have the opportunity to learn a lot professionally, but also enjoy great conversations and fresh and well informed points of view. Additionally, you will be working closely with all RnD teams, including Biomedical Science, Biochemistry, Biophotonics, and Electrical Engineering.




Don't forget to check the team on our website!

Our recruitment process

The interview process consists of 3 stages:

Introduction call (20 min - led by hiring manager - remote with video)
Technical Interview (60-90min - led by engineers from the team - remote with video)
On-site interview (90 - 120 min - Culture & Team fit, Lab tour, if role requires meet members from other teams - in person in our office and lab in Pfäffikon)
Show more
HTML:
About Liom:

Liom is a Swiss medtech venture with the vision to use state-of-the-art detection techniques to continuously monitor and learn from a wide range of vital medical indicators, allowing to improve your individual health.


What could you build on top of real-time and non-invasive Glucose monitoring? That is what Liom is all about, and we want to beat Apple at it.


Machine learning, personalized health, and predictive medicine. If these areas resonate with you, join us to work on foundational technologic and scientific challenges at Liom. We are a Swiss MedTech venture with the vision to use state-of-the-art detection techniques to continuously monitor and learn from a wide range of vital indicators, to better manage chronic diseases, to customize critical treatments and, to improve your health.


Your mission:

Using proprietary optical sensors, Liom is building a cutting-edge biomedical data generation pipeline to train medical-grade Machine Learning algorithms to infer glucose transcutaneously from spectral measurements. To achieve our vision, our team and advisory board consist of world experts coming from top academic institutions (ETH, EPFL, Columbia, Princeton, or Harvard among others) and industry leaders (Baxter, Roche, Lonza). We are looking for talented, experienced, voraciously curious, and self-driven professionals to join an A-team of doers: https://t.ly/vmCKi


After 4+ years in R&D phase, we are sprinting towards product development phase to launch to market. Therefore, joining as one of the first 60 permanent employees provides you great opportunities for growth in responsibilities and impact.


Responsibilities:

As a Sr. Machine Learning Engineer you will build ML Engineering infrastructure needed to deploy a portfolio of ML models and algorithms on our smartwatch and companion mobile Apps. To be effective in this role, you need to effectively interface with Science (ML Scientists, Data Scientists), Product Development (Electrical Engineering, Photonics, Manufacturing) and Product Management, to acquire and smartly embed multi-disciplinary knowledge into our ML Infrastructure.


You will be joining the Machine Learning Research & Engineering team, currently composed by 20 awesome colleagues. You will be working hand-in-hand with an A-team of 3 Software Engineering leaders, coming from the domains of Data, Cloud and App/Web development with a combined 40YOE in tech, plus an amazing and enthusiastic crew of junior engineers.


Your profile:

  • Master's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent ML experience.
  • 8+ years of experience in writing software working with at least one compiled and one interpreted language such as Python, JavaScript, Java, Go, C, C++
  • 6+ years of Machine Learning Experience in industry developing and deploying ML models in real-world applications.
  • Proficiency in software development methodologies, version control systems (e.g., Git), and CI/CD pipelines is essential.
  • In-depth understanding of MLOps principles and best practices, including model versioning, continuous integration and deployment of machine learning models, model monitoring, automated retraining, scalability and resource optimization. Experience with MLOps tools such as Kubeflow, MLflow.
  • Familiarity with containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes) and infrastructure-as-code tools (e.g., Terraform) is beneficial.
  • High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities, being comfortable in a dynamic and sometimes ambiguous environment.
  • The following qualifications are a plus:
  • Experience with distributed computing platforms (e.g., Spark) and cloud-based machine learning services (e.g., AWS SageMaker, Google Cloud Vertex AI )
  • Experience with Machine Learning at the Edge (optimization, HW accelerators, GPU, distributed computing)
  • Compliance and Governance: Understanding of compliance requirements and governance frameworks relevant to machine learning deployments, such as data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA) and medical device industry-specific standards would be a plus


IMPORTANT: we cannot sponsor working permits for non-EU / EFTA nationals for this role. Applications that do not fulfill this criteria will be automatically rejected.


We offer

Work/Life Balance

Working at a growing MedTech start-up is demanding and our goals are ambitious, which is why our team puts a strong emphasis on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. Therefore, we offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal life.


Values and Mission are important at Liom, as the ultimate goal is to improve people's well-being and we aspire to live that. We will have the chance to discuss value and mission during the interview process.


Diversity

With 18 nationalities in the company, we strive to build a diverse and exciting environment. Within the SMLE team we take special care of gender diversity - currently balanced at 50/50 among the permanent employees- and equal opportunities.


Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We want you to grow with Liom.


Amazing team!

In this role, you will be part of the Machine Learning Research & Engineering team, currently composed by 20 awesome colleagues from which you will have the opportunity to learn a lot professionally, but also enjoy great conversations and fresh and well informed points of view. Additionally, you will be working closely with all RnD teams, including Biomedical Science, Biochemistry, Biophotonics, and Electrical Engineering.


Don't forget to check the team on our website!

Our recruitment process

The interview process consists of 3 stages:

  1. Introduction call (20 min - led by hiring manager - remote with video)
  2. Technical Interview (60-90min - led by engineers from the team - remote with video)
  3. On-site interview (90 - 120 min - Culture & Team fit, Lab tour, if role requires meet members from other teams - in person in our office and lab in Pfäffikon)

Title: Sr. Applied Research Scientist
Description:
Work at Radformation

Cancer rates increase year after year, yet high-quality care is not universal. By automating and standardizing the treatment planning workflow, Radformation aims to create a system where any patient anywhere can receive the same high-quality care.

We strive daily to reduce cancer's global impact and help save more of the 10 million lives it claims each year. Our unwavering commitment is to deliver reliable, high-quality, automated solutions that allow clinics to standardized care for every single person in need.

Radformation is seeking a self-directed Senior Applied Research Scientist to join our innovative and fast moving team. This role is ideal for someone who wishes to develop novel radiotherapy algorithms and use their skills to improve cancer care throughout the world. You will work within Radformation’s fully remote teams to develop analytical dose calculation algorithms and related radiation oncology software.

The Senior Applied Research Scientist is responsible for all aspects of novel algorithm development, including user research, problem statement and definition, prototyping, defining validation methods, validating proposed solutions, documenting algorithm performance, and translating prototypes into engineered solutions together with our software engineering teams.

Applied Scientists are able to take a solution from concept to product. Your research skills, experience, and knowledge will play a key role in helping us design new products for cancer centers.

Responsibilities


Take technical ownership of Radformation proprietary dose calculation algorithms
Work with research and product teams to create new radiotherapy products and algorithms
Test and benchmark Radformation proprietary algorithms against industry standard algorithms





Abilities


Strong understanding of programming concepts with experience using a modern language
Ability to actively communicate with customers and other staff members
Ability to aggregate feedback and requests from clinicians to identify general problems solvable through automated methodologies
Strong organizational and time management skills
Ability to think and act strategically and proactively
Strong writing and presentation skills





Required Experience


Deep understanding of traditional dose calculation methods (Pencil Beam, CVSP, etc)
Able to formulate experiment design and run experiments while developing new algorithms and technology
Able to stay current with state-of-the-art algorithmic techniques
Experience conceiving, implementing, and maintaining clinically used software solutions





Preferred Experience


Deep understanding of Monte Carlo simulation methods used for dose calculation in Radiotherapy





What makes us so RAD?

We take care of our people!

Radformation offers top-tier medical, dental, vision care for employees and their families. Each role comes with our 401(k) & employer match vest immediately and you'll never have to stress about taking the time you need with self-managed PTO. We support our growing RAD families with generous parental leave, along with additional part-time work to help transition back into the swing of things. We are a fully remote team and while we may be apart, virtual events, yearly retreats and a collaborative work environment keep us close and connected.

Cancer transcends any individual differences we may have. That's why at Radformation we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.

Salary listed is in USD for US-based employees and will be commensurate with experience. Salary range will vary for international candidates and be commensurate with experience and geographical location.

Title: Business Intelligence & AI Python Developer
Description:
In this role you will work with our Data Science & Intelligence Department to create or update Power BI reports based on business requirements, to explore new technology solutions and

develop Python applications that integrate GenAI solutions with business data.




Key Responsibilities:

Design of new Power Bi reports and enhancements of existing ones
Understand the business requirements to provide useful insights on data
Augment the internal knowledge of business processes and data
Collaborates with database engineers to create end-to-end data pipelines
Present information using novel data visualization techniques
Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges
Develop and enhance internal Python Applications that use Generative A




Education & Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, Mathematics or similar degree
2+ Years as Power BI Developer
2+ Years of Python Programming
Experience with requirements engineering, translation of business requirements into IT solution design
Very good understanding of Data onboarding and Data modeling techniques
GenAI Experience (Optional)




Skills & Competencies:

Fluent English language skills, additional language is an advantage
Power BI Modelling and Report Creation
Practiced with relational database querying (SQL)
Familiarity with Git/Azure DevOps
Skilled in Python Programming
Outstanding communication skills
Familiarity with Cloud services like Azure
Experience with API/Containers/LLMs
Strong documentation skills
Self-starter and proactive
Nice to have: pySpark, Typescript

Title: AI Researcher (LLM) - (100% remote - Switzerland)
Description:
Join Tether and Shape the Future of Digital Finance

At Tether, we’re not just building products, we’re pioneering a global financial revolution. Our cutting-edge solutions empower businesses—from exchanges and wallets to payment processors and ATMs—to seamlessly integrate reserve-backed tokens across blockchains. By harnessing the power of blockchain technology, Tether enables you to store, send, and receive digital tokens instantly, securely, and globally, all at a fraction of the cost. Transparency is the bedrock of everything we do, ensuring trust in every transaction.

Innovate with Tether

Tether Finance: Our innovative product suite features the world’s most trusted stablecoin, USDT, relied upon by hundreds of millions worldwide, alongside pioneering digital asset tokenization services.

But that’s just the beginning:Tether Power: Driving sustainable growth, our energy solutions optimize excess power for Bitcoin mining using eco-friendly practices in state-of-the-art, geo-diverse facilities.

Tether Data: Fueling breakthroughs in AI and peer-to-peer technology, we reduce infrastructure costs and enhance global communications with cutting-edge solutions like KEET, our flagship app that redefines secure and private data sharing.

Tether Education: Democratizing access to top-tier digital learning, we empower individuals to thrive in the digital and gig economies, driving global growth and opportunity.

Tether Evolution: At the intersection of technology and human potential, we are pushing the boundaries of what is possible, crafting a future where innovation and human capabilities merge in powerful, unprecedented ways.

Why Join Us?

Our team is a global talent powerhouse, working remotely from every corner of the world. If you’re passionate about making a mark in the fintech space, this is your opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest minds, pushing boundaries and setting new standards. We’ve grown fast, stayed lean, and secured our place as a leader in the industry.

If you have excellent English communication skills and are ready to contribute to the most innovative platform on the planet, Tether is the place for you.

Are you ready to be part of the future?

About The Job

At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.

This role is uniquely positioned to oversee the creation and optimization of AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops. Your leadership will guide our team in pushing the boundaries of AI, making high-performance AI technologies accessible and efficient for personal use while setting new industry standards for innovation and utility.

What You'll Do:


Research and Development of multimodal AI models that set new industry standards.
Collaborate with other departments to ensure our AI models are effectively integrated into market-driven solutions.
A degree in Computer Science. Ideally PhD in NLP, Machine Learning, or a related field, complemented by a solid track record in AI R&D(with good publications in A* conferences).
Experience building a LLM or other large models from scratch including writing model code, gathering training data, optimizing training and inference.
Strong experience in NLP, multimodal learning, proficient in TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
Excellent programming skills in Python.
Show more

Title: Software Engineer (Python)
Description:
Garda Capital Partners (Garda) is a multi-billion dollar alternative investment firm with over 20 years of experience deploying relative value strategies across fixed income markets for institutional investors. Garda has offices in Wayzata, New York City, West Palm Beach, Geneva, Zug, Copenhagen, Singapore, and Scottsdale.

Garda is looking to hire a Software Engineer (Python) to be a part of our Research and Technology (R&T) team based out of our Geneva office. This is an exciting position offering opportunities to gain exposure to enterprise software development practices at a global hedge fund.

Position Responsibilities:


Aid in the development of new lines of business solutions using Python, Excel and Relational Databases
Support senior staff in designing and implementing complete solutions for our front office/risk systems.
Provide support for in-house and 3rd party applications


Qualifications & Desired Skills:


1+ Year of object-oriented development, preferably with Python (using common programming design patterns and good practices)
1+ Year of relational database and SQL experience, data modeling, and database design
Experience with Excel a plus
Experience with Python Data Stack (Pandas, NumPy, SQLAlchemy, etc.
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Finance
Must be comfortable with development across the application stack
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Passionate about programming and technology
Interest in financial trading industry
Ability to work effectively in a high-energy, time sensitive team environment
Detail-oriented with strong verbal and written communication skills
Knowledge of fixed income trading and related financial instruments including bonds and interest rate derivative products preferred, but not required

Title: Data Scientist / Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Das erwartet dich bei uns

Bist du bereit, uns dabei zu helfen, die Online-Reisebranche zu revolutionieren? Bei HolidayCheck ist es unsere Vision, den Urlaub für unsere Kund*innen besser zu machen. Wir nutzen Daten und Technologie, um echten Mehrwert für Menschen zu schaffen, die nach ihrem Traumurlaub suchen. Wir sind bestrebt, die führende Plattform für authentische Hotelbewertungen auf dem deutschen Markt zu bleiben – und dafür brauchen wir deine Expertise!

Wenn du Data Scientist/Analyst (m/w/d) mit einem besonderen Fokus auf die Erkennung von Betrugsmustern bist, unterstütze unser herausragendes Team in Bottighofen direkt am Bodensee.

Deine Aufgaben


Du arbeitest eng mit unserem Content-Trust-Team zusammen, um Muster und Netzwerke betrügerischer Bewertungen zu identifizieren
Basierend auf diesen Erkenntnissen arbeitest du daran, mögliche Maßnahmen zur Verbesserung unseres internen Systems zur Betrugserkennung zu entwickeln
Gemeinsam mit den Data Scientists und ML-Ingenieur*innen im Team hilfst du dabei, verschiedene Aspekte unseres Betrugsprozesses zu automatisieren
Du führst außerdem Analysen und verwandte Themen durch, um Erkenntnisse über unsere User Generated Content (UGC) zu gewinnen


Unser Team


Unser Team operationalisiert Daten für unsere Kund*innen und internen Stakeholder. Einige unserer Projekte sind: Erkennung von Bewertungsbetrug, Hotel-Empfehlungen, Auswahl von Deals/Angeboten, Buchungswahrscheinlichkeitsvorhersage, Informationsextraktion aus Hotelbewertungen, Kundensegmentierung und mehr.
Wir sind ein internationales Team an mehreren Standorten in der Schweiz, Deutschland und Polen.


Wir freuen uns auf dich, wenn du folgendes mitbringst


Du hast bereits Erfahrung in der Analyse von Betrugsmustern gesammelt, idealerweise im Zusammenhang mit Bewertungen
Du fühlst dich sicher im Umgang mit SQL (und hast bereits einige Fähigkeiten in NoSQL-Datenbanksystemen erworben)
Du liebst es, Daten auf kreative Weise zu analysieren, mit einem klaren Fokus auf der Identifizierung relevanter Muster für bestehende Geschäftsprobleme
Du kennst dich mit der Erstellung von Dashboards aus (idealerweise mit Google Looker Studio, Tableau oder Power BI)
Du hast Erfahrung mit Python (bevorzugt) und/oder R
Du besitzt gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, einschließlich der Fähigkeit, deine Arbeit auch für Laien verständlich zu präsentieren und deine Kernmetriken zu visualisieren
Du bist ein Teamplayer und arbeitest gerne mit anderen zusammen. Du teilst gerne Wissen und bist daran interessiert, voneinander zu lernen
Du bist in der Lage, den Kern komplexer Problemstellungen auf kreative, einfache und richtige Lösungsansätze herunterzubrechen
Du bist vertraut mit den Standardkonzepten aus dem Bereich Data Science
Du bist fließend in Englisch und sprichst Deutsch auf muttersprachlichem Niveau (Deutsch ist die Hauptsprache unserer Hotelbewertungen, Englisch die Unternehmenssprache)


Das können wir dir bieten - Unser "All Inclusive Package"


20 Tage Workation: Pack deinen Laptop ein und genieße 20 Tage im Jahr an atemberaubenden Orten innerhalb der EU. Strand, Berge oder lebendige Metropolen - du hast die Wahl!
60/40 Hybrid Modell: Mit unserem 60/40 Hybrid Modell kannst du flexibel zwischen Remote-Arbeit und Büropräsenz jonglieren. Gestalte deine Arbeitswoche nach deinen Vorlieben und treffe an unseren 2 Office Tagen pro Woche deine KollegInnen für Brainstorming Sessions, Tischtennis Battles oder inspirierende Gespräche!
Vielfältige Unternehmenskultur: Erlebe eine Weltreise in einem einzigen Unternehmen. Mit über 30 Nationalitäten in unserem Team erlebst du eine vielfältige und inspirierende Unternehmenskultur, die dir neue Perspektiven und Möglichkeiten eröffnet.
Onboarding Programm: Vom Newbie zum Champion - wir begleiten dich auf deinem "Roundtrip" durch HolidayCheck und stellen sicher, dass du dich von Anfang an wie zu Hause fühlst.
Flexible Arbeitszeiten: Wir bieten flexible Arbeitszeiten, damit du deine Arbeit an deine individuellen Bedürfnisse anpassen kannst. Langschläfer oder Frühaufsteher - bei uns ist für jeden was dabei.
Kostenfreier Parkplatz oder Subventionierung der öffentlichen Verkehrsmittel: Du kannst dich entscheiden, ob du dein Auto auf deinem persönlichen kostenlosen Parkplatz parken möchtest oder von der Subventionierung der öffentlichen Verkehrsmittel in München profitieren möchtest.
Family-Friendly: Mit einem Kita-Zuschuss sorgen wir für die richtige Work-Life-Balance, damit sich auch um deine Liebsten gekümmert wird, während du deiner Passion im Arbeitsalltag folgst
Weiterbildungsbudget: Nicht umsonst ist einer unserer Unternehmenswerte #better. Mit einem individuellen Weiterbildungsbudget und einem umfangreichen Trainingsangebot unterstützen wir dich dabei, neue Fähigkeiten zu erlernen und dein volles Potenzial auszuschöpfen!
Jubiläumsjubel: Mit unseren Anniversary Vouchers feiern wir deine langjährige Zugehörigkeit und zeigen dir unsere Wertschätzung u. a. mit zusätzlichen Urlaubstagen oder einem monetären Zuschuss für deine nächste Traumreise.
Tech-Freiheit: Bei uns bestimmst du, wie du arbeitest! Du hast die Freiheit, dir deine Arbeits-Hardware selbst auszusuchen, sei es ein MacBook, ein Windows-Laptop oder Linux. Entfalte deine Kreativität mit der passenden Hardware.
Fit und Kulinarik: Wir legen Wert auf deine Gesundheit und Fitness. Mit exklusiven Fitnessrabatten kannst du dich in Form halten und in unserer subventionierten Kantine in München und bei unserer großartigen Köchin Evelyn in Bottighofen erwarten dich köstliche und gesunde Mahlzeiten. Ein Genuss für Körper und Geist!


Bist du bereit, dich dem HolidayCheck-Abenteuer anzuschließen? Dann schnapp dir deinen Koffer voller Talente und schicke uns deine Bewerbung! Zeig uns, wer du bist, was dich antreibt und warum du Lust hast, gemeinsam mit uns Urlaub besser zu machen.

Apply for this job

Über uns

Die HolidayCheck Group AG ist eines der führenden europäischen Digitalunternehmen für UrlauberInnen. Wir vereinen unter unserem Dach das Hotelbewertungs- und Reisebuchungsportal HolidayCheck, den Reiseveranstalter HolidayCheck Reisen sowie die MietwagenCheck und Driveboo Mietwagenportale.

Gemeinsam haben wir die Vision, Urlaub besser zu machen. Das Herz unserer Unternehmenskultur sind unsere Werte, die wir im Arbeitsalltag leben und die ein Umfeld schaffen, in dem Du Dich kontinuierlich weiterentwickeln kannst.

Stehst Du auch hinter unseren Werten und bist bereit für die Reise mit HolidayCheck? Dann werde Teil unseres Teams!
Show more
HTML:
Das erwartet dich bei uns

Bist du bereit, uns dabei zu helfen, die Online-Reisebranche zu revolutionieren? Bei HolidayCheck ist es unsere Vision, den Urlaub für unsere Kund*innen besser zu machen. Wir nutzen Daten und Technologie, um echten Mehrwert für Menschen zu schaffen, die nach ihrem Traumurlaub suchen. Wir sind bestrebt, die führende Plattform für authentische Hotelbewertungen auf dem deutschen Markt zu bleiben – und dafür brauchen wir deine Expertise!

Wenn du Data Scientist/Analyst (m/w/d) mit einem besonderen Fokus auf die Erkennung von Betrugsmustern bist, unterstütze unser herausragendes Team in Bottighofen direkt am Bodensee.

Deine Aufgaben

  • Du arbeitest eng mit unserem Content-Trust-Team zusammen, um Muster und Netzwerke betrügerischer Bewertungen zu identifizieren
  • Basierend auf diesen Erkenntnissen arbeitest du daran, mögliche Maßnahmen zur Verbesserung unseres internen Systems zur Betrugserkennung zu entwickeln
  • Gemeinsam mit den Data Scientists und ML-Ingenieur*innen im Team hilfst du dabei, verschiedene Aspekte unseres Betrugsprozesses zu automatisieren
  • Du führst außerdem Analysen und verwandte Themen durch, um Erkenntnisse über unsere User Generated Content (UGC) zu gewinnen

Unser Team

  • Unser Team operationalisiert Daten für unsere Kund*innen und internen Stakeholder. Einige unserer Projekte sind: Erkennung von Bewertungsbetrug, Hotel-Empfehlungen, Auswahl von Deals/Angeboten, Buchungswahrscheinlichkeitsvorhersage, Informationsextraktion aus Hotelbewertungen, Kundensegmentierung und mehr.
  • Wir sind ein internationales Team an mehreren Standorten in der Schweiz, Deutschland und Polen.

Wir freuen uns auf dich, wenn du folgendes mitbringst

  • Du hast bereits Erfahrung in der Analyse von Betrugsmustern gesammelt, idealerweise im Zusammenhang mit Bewertungen
  • Du fühlst dich sicher im Umgang mit SQL (und hast bereits einige Fähigkeiten in NoSQL-Datenbanksystemen erworben)
  • Du liebst es, Daten auf kreative Weise zu analysieren, mit einem klaren Fokus auf der Identifizierung relevanter Muster für bestehende Geschäftsprobleme
  • Du kennst dich mit der Erstellung von Dashboards aus (idealerweise mit Google Looker Studio, Tableau oder Power BI)
  • Du hast Erfahrung mit Python (bevorzugt) und/oder R
  • Du besitzt gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, einschließlich der Fähigkeit, deine Arbeit auch für Laien verständlich zu präsentieren und deine Kernmetriken zu visualisieren
  • Du bist ein Teamplayer und arbeitest gerne mit anderen zusammen. Du teilst gerne Wissen und bist daran interessiert, voneinander zu lernen
  • Du bist in der Lage, den Kern komplexer Problemstellungen auf kreative, einfache und richtige Lösungsansätze herunterzubrechen
  • Du bist vertraut mit den Standardkonzepten aus dem Bereich Data Science
  • Du bist fließend in Englisch und sprichst Deutsch auf muttersprachlichem Niveau (Deutsch ist die Hauptsprache unserer Hotelbewertungen, Englisch die Unternehmenssprache)

Das können wir dir bieten - Unser "All Inclusive Package"

  • 20 Tage Workation: Pack deinen Laptop ein und genieße 20 Tage im Jahr an atemberaubenden Orten innerhalb der EU. Strand, Berge oder lebendige Metropolen - du hast die Wahl!
  • 60/40 Hybrid Modell: Mit unserem 60/40 Hybrid Modell kannst du flexibel zwischen Remote-Arbeit und Büropräsenz jonglieren. Gestalte deine Arbeitswoche nach deinen Vorlieben und treffe an unseren 2 Office Tagen pro Woche deine KollegInnen für Brainstorming Sessions, Tischtennis Battles oder inspirierende Gespräche!
  • Vielfältige Unternehmenskultur: Erlebe eine Weltreise in einem einzigen Unternehmen. Mit über 30 Nationalitäten in unserem Team erlebst du eine vielfältige und inspirierende Unternehmenskultur, die dir neue Perspektiven und Möglichkeiten eröffnet.
  • Onboarding Programm: Vom Newbie zum Champion - wir begleiten dich auf deinem "Roundtrip" durch HolidayCheck und stellen sicher, dass du dich von Anfang an wie zu Hause fühlst.
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten: Wir bieten flexible Arbeitszeiten, damit du deine Arbeit an deine individuellen Bedürfnisse anpassen kannst. Langschläfer oder Frühaufsteher - bei uns ist für jeden was dabei.
  • Kostenfreier Parkplatz oder Subventionierung der öffentlichen Verkehrsmittel: Du kannst dich entscheiden, ob du dein Auto auf deinem persönlichen kostenlosen Parkplatz parken möchtest oder von der Subventionierung der öffentlichen Verkehrsmittel in München profitieren möchtest.
  • Family-Friendly: Mit einem Kita-Zuschuss sorgen wir für die richtige Work-Life-Balance, damit sich auch um deine Liebsten gekümmert wird, während du deiner Passion im Arbeitsalltag folgst
  • Weiterbildungsbudget: Nicht umsonst ist einer unserer Unternehmenswerte #better. Mit einem individuellen Weiterbildungsbudget und einem umfangreichen Trainingsangebot unterstützen wir dich dabei, neue Fähigkeiten zu erlernen und dein volles Potenzial auszuschöpfen!
  • Jubiläumsjubel: Mit unseren Anniversary Vouchers feiern wir deine langjährige Zugehörigkeit und zeigen dir unsere Wertschätzung u. a. mit zusätzlichen Urlaubstagen oder einem monetären Zuschuss für deine nächste Traumreise.
  • Tech-Freiheit: Bei uns bestimmst du, wie du arbeitest! Du hast die Freiheit, dir deine Arbeits-Hardware selbst auszusuchen, sei es ein MacBook, ein Windows-Laptop oder Linux. Entfalte deine Kreativität mit der passenden Hardware.
  • Fit und Kulinarik: Wir legen Wert auf deine Gesundheit und Fitness. Mit exklusiven Fitnessrabatten kannst du dich in Form halten und in unserer subventionierten Kantine in München und bei unserer großartigen Köchin Evelyn in Bottighofen erwarten dich köstliche und gesunde Mahlzeiten. Title: Data Scientist
Description:
JOB PURPOSE

Are you passionate about uncovering insights from data and driving innovative solutions? Do you excel at solving complex problems and developing advanced models? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Scientist to join our dynamic Revenue Management team. In this role, you'll harness your expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning to optimise our revenue strategies.


KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

• Analyse large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for revenue growth.

• Develop and implement predictive models to forecast demand and optimise pricing strategies.

• Apply time series analysis and machine learning theory to improve demand forecasting and inventory management.

• Manage and improve interactive web applications for data visualisation.

• Perform web scraping to gather external data relevant to revenue management.

• Generate actionable insights from data analysis to support decision-making processes.

• Present findings and recommendations in a clear and concise manner.

• Review and document code to ensure clarity, maintainability, and best practices.

• Stay current with industry trends and advancements in data science methodologies.


QUALIFICATIONS

• Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.

• Proven experience as a Data Scientist, preferably in the travel, hospitality, or related industries.

• Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and SQL.

• Experience with TensorFlow, Keras, Streamlit, Prophet.

• Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.

• Knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, and time series analysis.

• Excellent communication and presentation skills.

• Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

• Knowledge of web scraping techniques and tools.

• Proven capability to industrialise models and implement solutions into production environments.

• Experience with deploying applications and models using Docker, Jenkins, and other similar tools.

• Strong skills in ETL processes and data architecture.


VISA REQUIREMENTS

EU Passport or Right to work in Switzerland.

Show more
